item.title: Specialist Business Analysis
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Specialist Business Analysis is responsible for identifying, eliciting, analyzing, specifying, and validating the business needs of users throughout CN and for specific projects or initiatives in the area of Rail Operational Technology. The Specialist acts as a liaison between the I&T groups (architecture, design, delivery, quality assurance, project management) and the business and translates needs into detailed stakeholder requirements/user stories, which the Specialist will follow through the project life cycle.

At CN, we are currently prioritizing the rail automation (Train Protection, Train Control, Automated rail and train inspections). The objectives of these initiatives increase rail safety through better monitoring and control of train movements. It consists of highly advanced operational technologies designed to improve safety and operational efficiency.

Main Responsibilities

Gathering and Managing Business Needs

·       Express business requirements in user stories

·       Elicit and document business requirements from internal and external partners (User Stories, Use Case, Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTMs), Workflow Diagrams, Responsible, Accountable, Consulting, Informed Matrix (RACI), etc.)

·       Define the business and solution requirements

·       Understand the solution gaps and communicate the impacts to the business

·       Maintain requirements changes traceability

·       Analyze, clarify and prioritize project requirements

·       Work with the product manager to ensure that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the teams will work on next

·       Liaison between business and implementation teams

·       Work closely with business partners and key IT groups (Architecture, Design, Change Management, Quality Assurance, Delivery, Project Management, etc.) to ensure successful project delivery

·       Apply, and ensure compliance with, all CN IT standards (Security, Architecture, Project Delivery Methodology, SOX, etc.)

·       Manage requirements throughout the life of the project

 

Cross Project Integration

·       Lead cross-functional collaboration with other projects or programs to validate business needs

·       Understand cross-project dependencies to align project deliverables

Business Analysis Practice Development

·       Work closely with the Business Analysis Lead and other I&T stakeholders on the continuous improvement of the business analysis framework and toolkit

Working Conditions

The Specialist may be required to travel occasionally in North America.

Requirements

Experience

Relevant Work Experience

·       Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience

·       Minimum 5 years of experience in business analysis and processes

·       Experience with system interface/ICD analysis

·       Experience with process mapping and project management methodology

·       Experience with software development

·       Experience with Data Analytics

·       Experience with communications protocols

·       Experience working in a safety environment

·       Experience within the rail industry, transportation, aerospace or telecom is considered an asset

·       Familiar with Agile methodologies

 

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or other relevant fields

·       IIBA Certification*

·       CBAP Certification*

·       SAFe Certification*

·       Scrum Master and/or Product Owner Certification*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

·       Works independently with little supervision and self-starter

·       Demonstrated success working with business and engineering teams to plan, develop, refine, and launch successful solution deliveries / products

·       Demonstrated ability to organize and facilitate workshops, interviews, and meetings, mindful of the impact of organizational change

·       Demonstrated ability to analyze, synthesize, document, translate and communicate business information to technical teams and vice versa

·       Excellent verbal and written communication and negotiation skills

·       Experience working with complex systems in large organizations

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Facilitation techniques

·       Process mapping

·       JIRA tool

·       Confluence tool

 

 About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.


 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Specialist- Data Engineering
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Specialist Data Engineering is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers, shaping the enterprise Data as a Service (DaaS) model and delivering on IT business models. The Specialist Data Engineering develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. The incumbent plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN’s data integration and DaaS platform roadmap.

Main Responsibilities

Data Engineering 

·       Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects

·       Optimize CN’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives

·       Build, manage, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers such as business or data analysts and data scientists

·       Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and engineer scalable data pipelines

·       Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines

·       Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives

·       Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes

·       Promote effective data management practices

Data Design 

·       Collaborate with stakeholders and architects to model data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches

·       Meet with stakeholders to identify fit-for-purpose within CN’s existing data ecosystem and deliver options and agile solutions

·       Design and develop processing pipelines that ingest data into Data Hubs

·       Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and non-technical teams

·       Participate in building data engineering expertise and framework

·       Translate business needs into technical requirements

Data Development

·       Acquire, ingest and process data from multiple sources and systems

·       Design and develop Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) pipelines using multiple sources of data in various formats

·       Conduct metadata management, data cleansing and preparation

·       Produce well documented quality codes

Data Operations 

·       Use Agile methodologies to streamline project delivery aligned with goals, timelines, and budget

·       Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines

·       Help unify software development and operations seamlessly, efficiently, and cost effectively

·       Improve software quality, automate processes, and accelerate software releases

Data Quality Assurance

·       Use Agile development practises for code reviews and testing to develop and deliver data pipelines

·       Develop and implement test plans and scripts for various data quality processes

·       Maintain manual and automated test scripts

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday and offers remote work.


Requirements

Experience

Data Engineering

·       Minimum 5 years of experience in a data engineering role, working in different data management disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimization and quality

·       Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of a departmental or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative

·       Experience with Scala or Java

·       Experience with SQL and NoSQL technologies

·       Fluent in writing, executing, and optimizing SQL queries

·       Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hive and Spark

·       Experience with Cloud platforms such as Azure, Google Platform or Databricks

·       Experience with Linux and shell scripting or Python

·       Experience in data profiling

·       Develop clean and maintainable code in a CI/CD environment (DevOps)

·       Experience in writing unit tests

·       Experience in translating business requirements into advanced data models able to fulfill analysts and data scientists requirements

.      Experience working in an Agile team environment

 

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Software Engineering

·       Google or Azure Data Engineering certification*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

·       Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

 .     Strong interpersonal relations, motivated and loves to work on multiple challenging projects

·       Well organized and able to self-prioritize, sometimes with conflictual deadlines

·       Continuously seeks for improvements and craves to put hands on new technologies

·       Ability to communicate complex solutions

·       Applies analytical thinking

·       Innovates through problem solving

·       Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

·       Demonstrates organizational abilities and detail oriented

·       Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

·       Works independently with little supervision

·       Applies agile mindset

·       Ability to work across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, extracting information and identifying linkages across disparate data sets

·       Demonstrates commitment to high standards of ethics, regulatory compliance, customer service, and business integrity

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Strong data analytics and development skills

·       Demonstrated creativity skills

·       Expertise in a combination of Scala, Java or Python

·       Expertise with Big Data architecture and distributed computing processes and platforms such as Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, etc.

·       Expertise with one or more SQL-on-Hadoop technology (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

·       Knowledge of software engineering best practices such as code reviews, testing frameworks, maintainability and readability

·       Expertise with Apache Storm*

·       Expertise with Databricks Delta Lake*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

Organizational Impact

Decision Making & Impacts

The Specialist Data Engineering is accountable for working with business stakeholders, Data and IT subject matter experts, and business leads to plan and delivery on the strategy and implementation roadmap of data pipelines.

Level of Interaction/Influence

The Specialist Data Engineering interacts primarily (80%) with internal stakeholders and partially (20%) with external contacts.

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.



 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Data Science Specialist
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

The role of Data Science Specialist is to ensure successful deployment of advanced infrastructure, telecom, machine learning, Industrial IoT, software development, application, and technology solutions, systems and services.  The specialist ensures that all business requirements are met by team members and projects, and contributes to the global evolution of CN’s I&T.

Clients can be from within CN’s I&T team or direct lines of business. The specialist  must build a full-time automated service between systems in the cloud for the positive train control with the machine learning and AI.   Be part of the system architecture for infrastructure as a code and Work CICD tool with azure DevOPS.  Be part of the technology exploration service to build the evolution of the existing services. Develop and maintain a virtualized and containerized infrastructure. Building test code, new design and optimisation monitoring tool.  Be part of the DevOPS team and lead after action review for operation support.

 

Main Responsibilities

·       Full stack development of AI Feature and application in various area.

·       Identify Models to be used and improve model accuracy

·       Participate in the product definition, especially around the aspect of AI, machine learning, to translate complex business requirement into concrete technical solution.

·       Create new optimisation for Infra monitoring with integration with third party or internal script(s).

·       Develop new way to get information from the application to get more data for the monitoring

·       Use the data in the log management for pattern recognition

·       Develop cloud design pattern for availability, data management, design and implementation, management and monitoring.

·       Build the structure for process and documentation

·       Be able to build solution with the Azure, Google cloud platform and DevOps marketplace.

·       Evolve and build best practice materials

·       Enable development teams to leverage cloud-native architectures with new and existing applications.

·       Build workshops and labs about cloud technologies, cloud operations, containers, orchestrators and microservices.

·       Be the technical leader for the system integration dev ops

 

Requirements

·       Minimum of 5 years of experience.

·       Computer Science or Engineering degree

·       Strong knowledge in cloud computing (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, DataBricks)

·       Strong familiarity with CNN for objects detection, segmentation and classification.

·       Strong Familiarity with machine learning application to time series analysis.

·       Experience with Tensorflow, Keras, Spark, Opencv, Pytorch, etc

·       Strong Knowledge in machine learning or AI feature and application in the SaaS software

·       Experience with Natural language processing, text understanding, classification, pattern recognition, recommendation systems, targeting systems, ranking systems or similar

·       Strong knowledge of CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Gitlab CI, Github Actions, etc)

·       In-depth experience gathering and interpreting business requirements to design and create scalable data science solutions

·       Familiarity with SQL, Hadoop, Hive, Spark Databases

·       Familiarity with MLFlow and pipeline monitoring

·       Experience working in Agile environments

·       Experience working with Big Data Analytics

·       Strong knowledge about coding in Python, Java.

·       Strong knowledge how to monitor application and infrastructure

·       Knowledge in logs management, application monitoring, infrastructure monitoring

·       Knowledge of monitoring and logging for containers and orchestrators.

·       Familiar with ISO30162 and IoT

 

 

Assets

  • Master or Ph.D in Computer Science, AI, machine learning or related technical field.
  • Strong knowledge in cloud computing (Azure, Google)

·       Knowledge of networking, security and protocol

·       PTC and Rail industry experience

·       IoT experience

·       MLOps Experience

·       Great Communication skills

·       Out of the box thinker

·       Devops Certification

·       Azure certification (developing solution)

·       Google certification

 

 

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - C360 Insights Team
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

The C360 Insights Team is part of the Campaign Management & Data Science group that supports one to one Marketing Campaigns for TELUS’ Mobility Customers. Our team is responsible for providing advanced analytics solutions to inform marketing campaigns that help deliver best in class customer experiences and business results for the organization. We develop machine learning and AI solutions leveraging the latest technology and Big Data assets that TELUS maintains.

 

We are a team of highly skilled and experienced data analytics professionals with diverse industry experience who collaborate to create value for our customers, organization and team.

 

Always wanted to work in a high performance team that strives to continuously grow and be part of a culture that embraces creativity, collaboration, diversity and a whole lot of fun? If so, we’d love to talk with you!

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Data Scientist, reporting to the Manager C360 Insights Team, you will play a pivotal role in enabling TELUS’ Marketing teams to achieve their business goals including revenue, EBITDA, churn, customer experience by developing advanced analytics solutions that support marketing strategy and campaigns.

 

As TELUS evolves its AI capabilities including Next Best Action engines, Customer Journey analytics solutions and transition to Cloud platforms you will be a key contributor and user of these capabilities.

 

You will work with a talented team of Data Scientists as well as analytics and marketing professionals to build advanced analytics solutions and derive business value from them.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Contribute to the development of teams’ deliverables like Next Best Action engines, Propensity Models, Natural Language Processing models, Near Real time Triggers, Customer Journey Analytics, Data Dashboards that inform marketing strategy and campaigns leveraging PySPARK, Python, SQL, etc
  • Own the end-to-end analysis including pre-analysis, trigger detection, predictive modeling and post campaign analysis
  • Present customer insights to cross-functional business partners including Marketing, Channel, Products & Services, Customer Experience and Digital
  • Support the transition of TELUS’ data assets and analytics machine learning solutions to Google Cloud Platform ensuring data security and privacy compliance
  • Maintain solid and updated knowledge in the domain of AI/ machine learning to continuously evolve TELUS’s AI assets while collaborating with and adding value to your fellow data science community
  • Work collaboratively with business partners teams to understand, compartmentalize complex and ambiguous business issues into crisp and manageable pieces

 

 

Qualifications

 

Must haves

 

  • Technical Expertise
    • Extensive Hands-on and industry experience in Python, SPARK, SQL and other data query language on UNIX / PC and comfortable working with very large data sets and databases
    • Extensive Hands-on experience with a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks
    • Knowledge of advanced statistical and data mining techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with business applications
    • Experience with Data Visualization tools like Domo/Tableau
    • Strong Quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills
    • 8+ years of progressive and relevant work experience
  • Business Orientation
    • Good business acumen, relationship management and influencing without authority skills
    • Ability to provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis
    • Strong Ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholders and meet deadlines with quality deliverables
    • Strong written, oral, communications, presentation skills and knowledge of Microsoft office/Google suite
  • Education
    • Masters/PhD degree in Computer Science Engineering/ Programming/ Statistics/Analytics

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Telecom industry experience
  • Working experience with Google Cloud Platform

 

Above all else we are seeking an enthusiastic ‘let’s do it’ attitude, motivation and a willingness to learn and collaborate. Please consider transferable skills, which will make you successful in this role and apply!

item.title: Data Scientist - Data Operations and Analytics
item.description:
Let the data do the talking! If you love a challenge and love Data, this role is for you.

 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

The Data Operations and Analytics team is an internally focused reporting and analytics product minded team within TELUS, responsible for reporting on key operational metrics to ensure we are delivering to our customers. We discover key insights into our outages and provide the day to day on our ability to deliver. The Reliability Center of Excellence mission is to aim for the highest degree of service reliability for our customers – and for our team. We are dedicated to support all aspects of improving reliability here within TELUS operations. Our team includes a passionate group of business analysts, network analysts, data analysts, data scientists and data engineers.

 

The Data Operations and Analytics team is looking for Data Scientists to play a key role in unlocking and driving outcomes for the Reliability Center of Excellence organization. This includes reporting results, uncovering insights, and developing AI/ML products that will enable our team to deliver on our Reliability promise.

 

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will collaborate with teams across the company, understanding the various areas within operations, seeking out new opportunities perfect for machine learning. Combining your expertise of data science with your strong software development skills, you will automate and facilitate data exploration, analytics, model development, training and deployment. 

 

Candidates for the role will be passionately curious to understand the ‘why’ behind the data and excited for the opportunity to play an integral role in steering a new data science team into maturity.

 

What you’ll do

 

 

  • Use data to tell the story of our operations and discover opportunities to improve our practices and enhance our decision-support ability
  • Explore raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Manage end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
  • Be an integral resource in the development and maturity of the data strategy within Data Operations and Analytics 

What you bring

 

  • A passion for how data can be used to uncover new insights, solve unique problems and drive effective actions
  • Be a strategic thinker and a bias for action and crafting and driving change
  • Be curious and creative in looking at metrics to identify and testing new critical metrics for the team
  • Have strong presentation skills with the ability to tell stories with data and master visualizations and be able to explain complex topics to non-technical audiences
  • You thrive in an environment where no playbook or rulebook exists, you will find a way through unforeseen challenges to obtain your goal
  • You value deploying the correct Machine Learning and AI solution for the task instead of relying on heavy computational neural networks
  • You are passionate about the learning new AI/ML techniques outside of your existing toolbox but has in-depth experience in one of the following: Linear Regression, Binary & Multiclass Logistic Regressions, K-means Clustering, Random Forests, Time Series Forecast, Matrix Factorization, LightBGM, Boosted Tree & XGBoost.
  • You have experience in NLP feature engineering and modeling (e.g., text classification, entity recognition, dependency parsing), NLU and Natural Language Inference.
  • You have mastered SQL and you develop in Python regularly and work with Pandas, Scikit-learn, and Numpy. You also have familiarity with Tensorflow.
  • You are a strong software developer and have experience with GitHub, and AI development lifecycles, including MLOps (CI/CD/CT)
  • You possess working knowledge of distributed computing and GPU computing and are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • Minimum of 3+ years of working with large data sets and analyzing data to identify patterns and in Writing and testing code proficiently 


Great to haves

 

  • Google Cloud Platform and tools knowledge 
  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent, or equivalent education and/or experience

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Description

 

JOIN OUR TEAM

 

Join the Procurement Analytics Center of Excellence (PACE), TELUS and support our mission to transform the chief procurement office (CPO) to a fully digital organization where data is at the heart of every decision we make. Enable stakeholders to efficiently evolve and consume actionable insights through transformation strategy.

 

We are an advanced data and AI team thriving on solving business problems and supporting procurement decisions using the power of data, advanced analytics, and reliable software. We provide end to end support from strategy and development to deployment and monitoring of all assets, including machine learning model, Tableau dashboards and data engineering ETLs using cutting edge Cloud technologies (e.g., Google BigQuery and GCP AI Platform), open source tools (e.g., Python, Sklearn, NLTK, Tensorflow), and enterprise products (e.g., Tableau, GitHub, Terraform).

 

In achieving our goal to enable data-driven decision making in CPO, PACE team is looking for an experienced data scientist who is able to regularly engage and interact with our business stakeholders to identify opportunities and develop complete solutions to turn data into insight for decision making.

 

What you’ll do:

 

As an experienced Data Scientist in PACE’s Insight Generation group, you will be at the front end, systematically analyzing and transforming vast amounts of tabular and unstructured data into actionable insights that are impactful in several ways to enable the organization to achieve their goals. We expect you to go above and beyond your role in working with like-minded, entrepreneurial colleagues to strengthen our data driven decision-making culture, improve the customer experience leading to revenue growth, cost reduction, and improved efficiency. You will be responsible to:

 

  • Work closely with business stakeholders to learn about data issues and insight gaps and take action to fill the gap
  • Work with the ‘Insight Generation ’ group within PACE and develop strategy for reporting, storytelling, and insight generation
  • Proactively looking at opportunities to blend data from across different enterprise systems to generate actionable insights that drive business value
  • Leverage innovative technologies and rigorous methods to extract, analyze, evaluate and interpret complex, multi-dimensional and constantly changing data
  • Question the status-quo and old processes, challenge assumptions, and advocate for AI and data-driven decision making across the chief procurement office
  • Influence PACE strategy and priorities while collaborating with other PACE team members to enable, design, develop, and deploy both data and visualization solutions
  • Mentor and coach other peers at PACE and upskill stakeholders to adopt and utilize reports, dashboards, and insights to inform day-to-day decision making
  • Provide technical coaching and mentoring to team members to ensure appropriate accessing, managing and interpretation of data

 

Qualifications

 

Who you are:

 

  • Hold PhD or master with major in data science, computer science, or applied mathematics (or related quantitative disciplines)
  • Minimum 5 years of experience with Tableau
  • Minimum 7 years of experience with SQL
  • Minimum 5 years of experience with Python for data science
  • Minimum 5 years of experience using data extraction and processing technologies to build advanced predictive models.
  • Prior experience with Agile and Jira
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to communicate data insight to business to various seniority levels of stakeholders
  • Team player

 

Great-to-have:

 

  • Knowledge and experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), including Google BigQuery and AI Notebook
  • Knowledge and experience with SAP S4 HANA, SAP ECC is a big asset
  • Familiar with software development methodologies and best practices
  • Experience in Natural Language Processing in Python
  • Experience in ML model production deployment and monitoring

item.title: Senior Product/Project Manager - Collaborative Health
item.description:
Join our team

 

TELUS Health is transforming healthcare by delivering connected solutions and services to empower people to live healthier lives.

 

We are explorers and passionate system thinkers. We are builders and dedicated craftspeople. We are connectors and agents of change. Our thinking is grounded in an appreciation for relentless discovery, and a holistic view of the industry, market, or organization. Our efforts are grounded in a sincere commitment to translate insight into opportunity, opportunity into concepts, concepts into products and products into businesses.  We achieve this with a dedication to our craft and collaboration at our core.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

At TELUS SKY, we’ve developed a future thinking integrated ecosystem for true health, wellness and behavioral care that bridges in-person and virtual experiences. Specifically, the SKY Experience assembles people, technologies and science into a single intuitive process that combines the best of premium in-person experiences with a seamless digital platform. By doing so, we are building one of the richest databases of wellbeing biomarkers, physical, psychological, sociological indicators. Combined with advancements in artificial intelligence (AI), we will have the ability to reexamine standard assumptions of care to impact individual health journeys.

 

We are currently looking for a blend of Senior Product / Project Manager to create a frictionless digital experience, working very closely with the Sr UX / CX experience designer. In this position, you will work with cross-functional teams to analyze business requirements, research, design, integrate, and deploy new technologies. The Senior Product/Project Manager will also manage effective relationships with internal stakeholders, regional partners, technology vendors and service providers.

 

 

What you’ll do: 

 

 

  • Create and drive the integration strategy and roadmap to connect various platforms in order to provide an end to end seamless customer experience
  • Contribute to the creation of a multi-year product strategy and roadmap for SKY that expertly balances innovation with reinforcing our commitments to members
  • Work closely together with the various TELUS LoB strategy, design and product teams to identify technological integration opportunities and align on strategies, roadmaps, priorities and dependencies that provide direct business value to our SKY members.
  • Lead the execution of the developed project roadmap
  • Partner with cross-functional Product and Developer teams and industry experts to explore how Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) technologies can better support our journey.
  • Work with our data science team to create a roadmap for future automated actions based on ML models
  • Facilitate, communicate, collaborate, negotiate between customer and technical teams to bring features to closure

What you bring:

 

  • You have 2+ years of Product or 7 + years of Project Management experience, ideally in SaaS
  • You are obsessed with delivering the most customer-centric experience, showing proven success in ownership, bias for action, and thinking big.
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a relevant field, or equivalent certifications and work experience
  • Visionary, innovative, forward-thinking and profoundly customer focused
  • The flexibility to quickly adapt and produce in a rapidly changing environment, meeting aggressive product launch schedules
  • Track record working in high-growth environments, and a comfort level with the pace of change and level of ambiguity that accompanies this
  • Ability to work independently. Self-starter, can-do attitude, ability to multitask and prioritize within and across complex projects
  • Strong relationship development skills - experienced in building and strengthening internal and external relationships over time, savvy at navigating negotiations and tradeoffs with current and prospective partners
  • Broad interest in healthcare innovation that spans digital, hardware/devices, and healthcare services

 

 

Why TELUS Health?

 

At TELUS, Collaborative Health you’ll join a diverse team dedicated to learning, teaching, and impact; as individuals and as a team. As a workplace, we care about our team members and have a total rewards package that makes being a part of TELUS Health something to be proud of:

 

  • 100% remote within Canada: so you can work where you feel most inspired (in-person if YOU want to!)
  • Stay healthy: flex benefits with options to customize coverage based on your lifestyle and needs, inclusively offering coverage for Gender Affirmation and Fertility treatments
  • Virtual Care: premium access to digital healthcare for you and a loved one; avoid long waits at the clinic, just chat with a medical professional from your couch
  • Work Life Integration: paid vacation and flexible well-being days
  • Family leave: mothers, fathers and adoptive parents benefit from a top-up during part of their leave
  • Pension plan: to help you save for the future with a generous company match (free money!)
  • Employee Share Purchase Plan: you can invest in our shared success, company matched
  • Wellness Spending Account: To support your whole person wellness
  • Learning and development: Internal resources for business, leadership, and technical skills 
  • Savings: who doesn’t love discounts? (on TELUS services and partner/supplier services and products)
  • Employee and family assistance: LifeWorks provides free services to support you through life events
  • Tools/Technology: Mac or PC, whichever enables you to do your best work

 

#LI-Remote

item.title: Data/ML Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

Join the Procurement Analytics Center of Excellence (PACE) and TELUS, and support our mission to transform the chief procurement office (CPO) into a fully digital organization where data is at the heart of every decision we make. Enable stakeholders to efficiently evolve and consume actionable insights through transformation strategies.

 

We are an advanced data and AI team thriving on solving business problems and supporting procurement decisions using the power of data, advanced analytics, and reliable software. We provide end-to-end support from strategy and development to deployment and monitoring of all assets, including machine learning model, Tableau dashboards, and data engineering ETLs using cutting-edge cloud technologies (e.g., Google BigQuery and GCP AI Platform), open source tools (e.g., Python, DBT, Nifi, Sklearn, NLTK, Tensorflow), and enterprise products (e.g., Tableau, GitHub, Terraform).

 

In achieving our goal of enabling data-driven decision-making in CPO, the PACE team is looking for an experienced data/ML engineer who can interpret the requirements of data and analytics use cases and scenarios, and drive the design and implementation of data pipelines and models to enable insights and analytics leading to better business decisions. 


What you’ll do:

 

As a Data/ML Engineer in PACE’s Insight Generation team, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and evolving our MLOps methodology for continuous delivery and integration of our data and model assets. You are also accountable for ingesting data from various sources and validating, normalizing, and cleaning data for business use, and deploying & maintaining ML models in production. The expectation is to go above and beyond your role in working with like-minded, entrepreneurial colleagues to strengthen the availability and reliability of our data following the state-of-the-art MLOps tech stack to support our data-driven decision-making culture. In this role, you are responsible to:
 

  • Developing, maintaining, and evolving our MLOps methodology
  • Design & build data extraction, loading, and transformation pipelines, and data products across on-prem and cloud platforms
  • Help integrate large datasets stemming from multiple data sources to be later used for data modeling and visualization
  • Own, design, and build the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning models
  • Own and develop relationships with various internal and external teams/vendors to bring data from across the organization to our central data/ML platform in the cloud
  • Bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, standard interfaces, and APIs
  • Assist in the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data
  • Develop test strategies and site reliability engineering measures for data products & solutions
  • Supervise or contribute to quality assurance efforts to make sure that the ingested data has and keeps the expected quality
  • Look proactively at opportunities to blend data across different enterprise systems to generate actionable insights that drive business value
  • Perform technical data stewardship tasks including metadata management, security, and privacy by design
  • Mentor and coach other peers at PACE and upskill stakeholders to adopt and utilize reports, dashboards, and insights to inform day-to-day decision-making

 

Qualifications

 

Who you are:

 

  • Hold PhD or Master\'s degree with a major in computer science, software engineering, or applied mathematics (or related quantitative disciplines)
  • Minimum 7 years of experience with SQL and database proficiency
  • Minimum 5 years of experience with Python
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with databases and data pipelines on cloud platforms
  • Minimum 5 years of experience using data extraction and processing technologies.
  • Minimum 2 years of data solution architecture and design
  • Prior experience with Agile and Jira
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to communicate data analytics and insights to business stakeholders
  • Ability to work and collaborate with team members

 

Great-to-have:

 

  • Knowledge and experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), including Google BigQuery
  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • Experience with job scheduling platforms and Orchestration (Apache NiFi, Apache airflow)
  • Familiar and preferably experienced with the life cycle of machine learning model development, deployment, and operationalization in large enterprises
  • Familiar with software development methodologies and best practices
  • DevOps and MLOPs practices and tools experience
  • Quality Assurance & Site Reliability Engineering
  • Familiarity with Data Build Tool (DBT)
  • Knowledge and experience with SAP S4 HANA, SAP ECC is a big asset

item.title: Full Stack Software Developer
item.description:
Description

 

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.
 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Reliability Data Engineering and Analytics Team at TELUS focusses on instantaneous detection of events that could lead to incidents, outages and negatively impact the customer experience.

 

As a Full Stack Software Developer, your innovative mindset, technical skills, and passion for growth will be critical in continuing to grow our data analytics practices for predictive insights and early detection of incidents. Be a part of the team that uses cutting edge technology to implement machine learning and predictive analytics which will shape tomorrow\'s AI Ops.
