item.title: Data Platform Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Platforms team is the hub of analytics at TELUS.  So much so that our future forward solution is known as Data Hub.  Our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the ability to put data into motion through batch and real-time processes to bring data from on-premise systems to cloud platforms. Our cloud presence allows TELUS teams to make use of cloud native functionality to drive reporting and developing machine learning models.  The sky\'s the limit.

 

We are looking for technical enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solution. Together we will build and enable best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding and automating our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.


 
Enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Use your analytical skills and ability to assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.

 

Here’s How

 

  • Work with and listen to business and technical teams to understand their needs
  • Define the ideal data flow and drive process and architecture changes to make it happen by collaborating with their owners
  • Design and implement solutions to move data across systems and locations
  • Collaborate kindly and proactively with the rest of our team and our customers (internal teams at TELUS)
  • Take solutions from concept to production by using 3rd party tools, writing code, config, and scripts
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Provision and maintain existing platforms to facilitate growth and stability
  • Author quality documentation for any solutions implemented on both how they were implemented and how to use them
  • Ensure the best practices are followed so that system uptime requirements are met
     

Qualifications

What you bring

 

  • You are kind and want to make things better for others in collaboration with others
  • You have hands-on experience with cloud-native technologies, such as Terraform
  • You can design and deploy distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You have used cloud platforms such as Google Cloud for application hosting
  • You have a 4+ years of experience in System Operations or Software Development 
  • You have experience using YAML and/or JSON for configuration
  • You can explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces, and APIs
  • You understand that system stability drives availability and customer trust
  • You are able to provision infrastructure and secure & reliable services and applications in the cloud
  • You are able to provide guidance to optimize data collection, storage, and consumption by choosing the right platforms and tools for the right use cases
  • You have experience deploying to and maintaining production environments
  • You don’t deploy to production on Fridays

 

Great-to-haves

 

 

  • Hands-on familiarity with at least one of: Kafka, Google Cloud Platform, NiFi
  • Comfortable with scripting languages
  • Understanding of DevOps, DataOps principles and tools
  • Data Warehousing design experience
  • Familiarity with monitoring, alerts, and logging solutions

item.title: Solution Architect
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

 

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

 

The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our assets from an on premise data lake to Google’s Cloud Platform.

 

Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.
 

What you’ll do     

 

  • Collaborate with both technology and business partners and domain architects in order to design robust enterprise grade solutions
  • Document various solution options and recommend the best approach balancing constraints and future needs
  • Propose solutions to enable business objectives while advancing enterprise tech strategies
  • Identify opportunities for and implement automation in the development and production process to reduce upfront hands-on work
  • Capture issues with the data that impact key business drivers and relay them to the product management teams
  • Support the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models
  • Participate in requirements review sessions or attend intake assessment meetings to estimate effort for high-level solutions
     

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are recognized for your 10+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You have an architecture level understanding of APIs, security architecture, and cloud native development on one of the major cloud providers (GCP, Azure, AWS)
  • You have experience with designing, developing, and operationalizing high-volume back-end web applications
  • You have experience with REST API design
  • You have strong proficiency with JavaScript and understand the nature of asynchronous programming

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • GCP experience and certification
  • Experienced in working with NodeJS

item.title: Manager-Technology Strategy - Wireless Core Network and Services DevOps
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

TELUS’ Wireless Core Network & Services Dev/Ops team is responsible architecture, deployment, optimization, and operations for technology platforms that support the national wireless core network. We have a unique opportunity for an engaging people leader to manage a software development team.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You will lead a team of engineers and software developers to transform to virtualized network functions, softwarize network services, and improve service reliability across core platforms. The team will work with our industry partners, both telco vendors and hyperscalers, to develop and operate wireless services including but not limited to system integration, software development, data analytics and automation. Your management skills, industry knowledge and technological leadership will shape TELUS’ next-generation networks and services.  Moreover, your natural abilities to collaborate with other teams such as Product and Sales will set you apart.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Coach, develop and inspire a diverse team of DevOps professionals
  • Solve problems and handle escalation in a collaborative and effective manner 
  • Set key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure individual and team successes
  • Build trust and partnership with internal/external stakeholders and lead customers
  • Develop and operate software solutions based on virtualized infrastructure and 5G 
  • Focus on reliability across critical user journeys
  • Using Agile engineering principles, you will lead the efforts to quickly adapt to new technologies, services and applications
  • With a constant focus on customer experience and industry trends, you will lead on-going improvements to our core to ensure the best customer experience every time, everywhere
  • Manage platform lifecycles, 3-year service roadmap and Capex/Opex budgets
  • Adopt principals of Reliability by Design, Security by Design and Privacy by Design

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Respected as a collaborative partner and trusted advisor who builds strong relationships across the organization and providing value add
  • Regarded as an excellent communicator, negotiator and influencer, able to communicate complex ideas and concepts to a variety of audiences including senior leaders in a clear, simple, easy to understand manner
  • Recognized for your Customer First mindset and delivering on optimal outcomes for both internal and external stakeholders
  • Sought out for your strategic thinking, business acumen, sound decision making and result-driven mindset with the ability to take initiative and ownership of complex issues through to resolution
  • Solid knowledge and understanding of:
    • Application integration models and methodologies
    • Agile development and DevOps methodologies
    • Application Development environments and technologies for delivering digital solutions
    • Software development and coding techniques 
    • Cloud native technologies and concepts
  • Proven business, financial and strategic skills with experience in assessing alternatives and business case development
  • Noted to have a high degree of curiosity, continuously learning new topics, concepts and technologies, and also looking beyond the surface level to understand the full picture and questioning/challenge the status-quo resulting to drive higher business value
  • Respected for your advanced knowledge of 3GPP (IMS/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) wireless core networks optimization and performance
  • Ability to interact with technical team members and distill complex ambiguous problems into actionable items
  • Experience negotiating with vendors for new technology and support agreements
  • Broad base of knowledge across IT and Network systems, support and processes
  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and/or relevant experience

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Big data correlation and machine learning knowledge
  • Experience in web/mobile applications development
  • Master of Engineering degree and/or MBA

item.title: Design Specialist (Cloud RAN Automation Technology and Performance)
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The latest Open RAN (Radio Access Network) technology brings not only BBU (baseband unit) cloudifications & virtualization, open interfaces between DU (Distributed Unit) and RU(Radio Unit) , but also introduces and enables ORAN intelligent automation platform namely SMO (Service Management and Orchestration) with RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) which applies automation at scale to simplify the complexity of ORAN networks, as well as improve network performance, enhance customer experience and minimize ORAN operational costs with ORAN analytics and assurance. 

 

TELUS is forming a new Cloud RAN automation platform DevOps team which will oversee the development, operations and evolution of ORAN SMO and RIC architecture and technology. We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth. We see great value in bringing Cloud, IP/MPLS, data analytics and software development professionals into this team in addition to RAN knowledge to not only develop these platforms but also enhance the systems to enable TELUS ORAN intelligent operations by closely working with TELUS Stakeholders, vendors and ORAN DevOps team.

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Be responsible for ORAN SMO (service management and orchestration) platform design and technology development, drive vendor’s SMO roadmap to align with TELUS’s ORAN automation strategies
  • Be responsible for ORAN RIC (RAN Intelligent Controller) platform design and technology development
  • Create ORAN automation policies & rules, templates & algorithms and workflow services for ORAN full stack automation, including vRAN Bare Metal, xHaul, CaaS, and vDU/vCU services. 
  • Develop O-Cloud (ORAN-Cloud) orchestration and federation solutions including ORAN IMS (Infrastructure Management Services) and DMS (Deployment management Services)
  • Responsible for ORAN Software and Hardware Life Cycle Management solution development and introduction
  • Lead the development of ORAN data processing workflow, as well as data pipelines system design and configurations to ensure data availability and integrity to end users
  • Define TELUS RIC model and algorithm standards for new xApp and rApp onboarding
  • Lead the integration with TELUS overarching remedy’s and systems
  • Drive Open SMO integration with TELUS’s selected vRAN solutions
  • Technology introduction of evolutionary ORAN OAM (FCAPS) via streaming telemetry
  • Lead SMO/RIC platform AI (Artificial Intelligent)/ML (Machine Learning) workflow services design and technology introduction

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • 5+ years of working experience on IP/MPLS and Kubernetes networking, familiar with associated protocols (VxLAN, Calico, CNI, M-LAG, EVPN etc.)
  • Experiences with LTE, 5G NSA (Non-stand alone) and SA (Standalone) RAN (Radio access network) technology
  • Expertise in one or more programming languages and data formats such as Java, Python, GO, XML, YAML, Shell Scripting, JSON, Restful APIs etc. 
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes services such as Google’s Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon’s Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), RedHat OpenShift, WindRiver Cloud platform, Robin.io cloud platform
  • Experience on managing and developing cloud-native containerized micro services
  • Experience on Kubernete cloud analytics tools (i.e beats, logstash, elasticsearch, kibana, Kafka and/or Prometheus)
  • Experience on large scale Kubernetes cluster orchestration and federation solutions and tools, familiar with Windriver central cloud and conductor, or Openshift ACM, or Robin MDCAP is a big asset for successful candidate 
  • Creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • Proactive, can lead cross-team initiatives
  • A Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems

 

Great-to-haves 

 

  • Experience in Requirements Engineering, Solution Architecture, Design, Development and Deployment Experience in Underlying infrastructure for Big Data Solutions (Clustered/Distributed Computing, Storage, Data Center Networking) 
  • Familiar with Open-RAN and ETSI specifications and standards
  • Multi- or Hybrid-cloud architectures
  • Experience with Big Data & Analytics tools such as Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Big Query, DataFlow etc.
  • Experience with AI/ML toolkits such as Tensor Flow, Mllib, H2Oai , Kubeflow etc

ORANJobs  *LI-hybrid *LI-remote

item.title: Splunk/New Relic Developer
item.description:
Description


Join our team

 

With the convergence of innovative home and mobile networking technologies including fiber and 5G, smart home solutions, mobile devices, automation, cloud computing and over-the-top capabilities, our customers’ homes look very different in today’s digital world. Every day, TELUS’ engineering and development teams are envisioning what the future holds and building the technologies to simplify our customers’ lives, provide services at the touch of a button and create immersive entertainment experiences. ffhjobs

 

We are the Future Friendly Home Services DevOps group, and we are looking for Splunk/New Relic developers to join our team! We are responsible for the end-to-end technology development and operations of TELUS’ Optik TV services, video and over-the-top services, broadband network capabilities, smart home solutions and software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) solutions. As a Splunk/New Relic developer, you will help us drive a large scale digital transformation program. It’s an exciting time to be a part of our mission to drive better outcomes through customer-centric, state-of-the-art software platforms.


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

  • Contribute to an inclusive, knowledgeable and highly motivated team, using SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) practices to frequently deliver valuable software to market
  • Unlock the power of cloud-native environments, having the freedom to leverage innovative technologies and the latest standards
  • Help drive a high-performance DevOps culture
  • Become a go-to expert on the code components you are responsible for and how they fit into the overall architecture, promoting a seamless solution
  • Power future possibilities for our customers and advance a compelling portfolio of technologies and services from consumer front ends, to streaming and content protection, to user entitlements and payments

 
Here\'s how

 

  • Provide day to day support for Splunk/New Relic environments and full system life cycle
  • Extensive working experience in creating and implementing dashboards
  • Analyze highly complex business requirements; generate technical specifications to design or redesign complex software components and applications
  • Act as a technical resource expert for modeling, simulation, and analysis efforts
  • Leverage industry best practices to design, test, implement and support the solution
  • Act as the Splunk/New Relic subject matter expert in providing technical leadership in the design, development and support, and other intelligence big data analytics industry initiatives
  • Use your experience to explore a variety of machine learning, statistical analytics, and data mining techniques to improve Corporate Security’s investigative capabilities using technology to support monitoring and digital fraud investigation needs
     

 

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience and extensive working knowledge, training and/or certifications in Splunk Enterprise (installing, configuring, troubleshooting different Splunk components and building clusters; integrating with external services; CI/CD deployment of elements and dashboards)
  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience and extensive working knowledge of New Relic (installing agents, configuring, troubleshooting different New Relic components; configuring API keys, integrating with external services; CI/CD deployment of elements and dashboards)
  • Extensive experience troubleshooting multi-layer frontend/backend systems.
  • Proficiency in Python, SPL language, XML, HTML, CSS, JSON, Excel
  • Solid understanding of SQL scripting for querying databases (MySQL, Postgresql, Cassandra, etc.)
  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience with Linux
  • 3 or more years of hands-on experience with Cloud technologies – GCP, AWS, or Azure
  • Deep knowledge of Kubernetes and underlying technologies
  • Must be self-motivated, energetic, and results-oriented and be committed to adding value to the organization
  • Highly flexible and able to adapt quickly to changing priorities

 

Great to Have

 

  • Bachelor\'s degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.
  • Deep knowledge of proxying and load balancing technologies such as HAProxy or NGINX
  • Experience in agile development practices including the ability to create CI/CD pipelines from scratch using tools such as: Jenkins, Gitlab and Github
  • Experience building positive relationships and collaborating with a variety of diverse groups and technical teams and able to translate technical concepts into easy-to-understand business language
  • A creative approach to problem solving and the ability to work independently to manage deliverables in an environment with high levels of ambiguity

item.title: Senior Strategy Manager
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together


This is a dream job for the curious, analytical mind wanting to push the boundaries and challenge the status quo. You will be professionally rewarded by the diversity of problems and data sets, and with your expertise, provide discoveries that will solve complex challenges and opportunities that drive strategic business decisions to delivering optimum business outcomes, including capital deployment plans, and exceptional customers experiences. Additionally, you will develop appropriate data models and frameworks, drawing from various data sources, to support business investments and improved MCE reliability.

 

Our team will formulate and facilitate strategies backed by data. You will use your past experiences to find data, analyze it for trends that support both short term tactics in support of strategies that may take years to achieve.

 

What you’ll do 


Reporting to the Director, Planning & Engineering with the Mission Critical Environments (MCE) team, you are responsible for leading the development and execution of MCE business and transformational programs, driving exemplary client experience and unit cost improvements.

 

You are a dynamic self-starter and thought leader with top-notch people skills and an analytical edge. You will create a consolidated business unit strategy across the MCE planning, operations, and build teams and lead the evolution / execution of multiple, high-priority business unit strategies and programs that will include executive updates via business case and presentations. You are MCE’s lead within the Reliability Leadership Team (RLT) delivering priority and reliability based capital funding requests.

 

You will develop the business unit and MCE capital strategy by:

 

  • Soliciting and consolidate inputs from various stakeholder teams to support the development of the MCE strategic plan, selected business planning roadmaps and issues and opportunities for improvement
  • Establish performance indicators that measure (metrics/KPIs) program success:
    • Develop, maintain and manage appropriate Scorecard (as a measure of success), including working with other relevant resources (x-functional SMEs, ops stakeholders) to define “success” for MCE programs, projects and initiatives
    • Ensure Scorecard Objectives are met – on time, on budget, in scope
    • Provide Executive level reporting
  • Building sound analytics and processes to support the improved understanding of all equipment failure rates and replacement options, including drawing conclusions and recommending proposals resulting from analysis
  • Solving diverse business problems in a data rich environment through data mining, predictive modeling, machine learning, statistics and other analytical techniques
  • Visualizing and reporting data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provides insights that will drive strategic business decisions
  • Supporting the development of the annual Strategy Check presentation and support of all yearly planning cycles
  • Lead multiple, large programs and support a high-performance, highly engaged cross-functional team responsible for executing on key cross-functional initiatives
  • Drive program execution against strategic, operational and financial objectives; own and deliver key tenants of MCE financial budget targets
  • Working within an agile/scrum environment
  • Fostering internal as well as external Partner and Client executive relationships

 

 

Qualification

 

What you bring

 

  • University degree (preferably in Engineering or Diploma in Engineering or Electronics plus experience in Statistic modeling)
  • 5 or more years of experience with data analytics experience covering large data volumes and complex data sets from varying sources
  • 5 or more years of experience within Network or IT operations
  • Knowledge or experience in strategic planning, business analysis and/or business systems analysis
  • Project management methodologies, principles and practices
  • Understanding of business drivers, customers and the links to IT strategies & priorities
  • Understanding of performance metrics development & analysis, process improvement or portfolio management
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to simplify the explanation of complex business challenges
  • Collaboration across all levels of the MCE team and with key stakeholders

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Six Sigma – green belt

item.title: Design Specialist II- Messaging Dev/Ops
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together


Our team objective is to enable and support our rapidly-evolving messaging products and services for our customers in the way that makes sense to them, is easy to understand and to use.

The Messaging DevOps team works closely with cross functional teams across the organization to realize our collective Customer First vision. We learn and grow through our experiences, new technology and process evolution and plan and prepare for the future! As experts in our fields, we’re a team who equally celebrates failure and success. Also, our mandate is also to improve network and service reliability, resiliency, and time to market while further developing our scripting and automation system capabilities for the future.


The Messaging team is seeking a creative, entrepreneurial, energetic, and bright candidate to join our team.


Your mission is to contribute to strategies supporting rollout of our services in 5G and beyond, in NFV / GCP, to contribute to the automation of routine/repetitive activities, to improve existing workflows and network capacity/service quality, to support the team with the real-time monitoring, maintenance, support, operations, including on-call. Last, but not least, to predict failure, initialize self-healing mechanisms and failover, and recommend proactive healing process. This is an opportunity to also shape and guide the next generation of technology professionals with your leadership, knowledge, curiosity and drive to do more for our customers.


What you’ll do 


We’re a dynamic team, so a high degree of flexibility is required to adapt to a wide variety of tasks and
functions.

  • Explore customer feedback and analytics to drive improvements in our products and services and   clearly see things from the perspective of a customer
  • Thrive in a lean, fast paced and changing environment
  • View collaboration as essential to your work
  • Have a passion for reliability
  •  Build, maintain and leverage strong relationships with your stakeholders and maintain a collaborative model in order to ensure that you are collectively meeting the requirements of the business 
  • Create, execute, improve and maintain automation test, provisioning, and workflow scripts through standard methodologies, closely monitor results, and participate in peer reviews
  •  Help drive the evolution of our teams towards a DevOps and Agile culture

What you bring

 

  • Visible champion and spokesperson for change
  • A strong end to end ownership culture mindset towards product and end customer experience
  • A very strong knowledge of Wireless (5G/LTE/HSPA), Fixed Voice (VoIP/NGN/TDM), Messaging (SMS/MMS/VMS) network architectures/call flows, technologies, networking routing, and signaling protocols 
  • Working knowledge of Telecommunication OSS and BSS management network and systems
  • Familiar with CI/CD (Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery), DevOps best practices
  • Experience with testing and provisioning automation tool sets (Sigos, Jenkins, Splunk, Python, Java, Robot Framework, postgres/sql database)
  • Working knowledge of API integration (REST/SOAP), XML, JSON, YAML
  • Hands-on experience in automation application/scripts development in various environments (Linux, Shell, Web, Windows, etc.) 
  • Know how to architect and deploy secure and robust services/applications on private cloud using NFV infrastructure, SDN (Openstack, Openshift, Contrail), GCP
  • A team player with ability to build relationships, influence others and foster ownership within cross-functional teams
  • Capable of tackling ambiguous problems, bringing structure and process to help shape solutions
  • Good written and oral communication skills, including creating and delivering presentations, summarizing technical content for an executive audience
  • 5+ of years of experience as a software developer or network engineering, preferably in a DevOps environment
  • Degree in Engineering or Computer Science 
  •  

Great-to-haves

 

  • Experience in the wireless core network, especially Messaging SMS, MMS, VMS, F5Load-balancers, Firewall
  • Experience in architecting solutions in a cloud environment
  • Experience in public cloud environment (GCP, AWS)
  • Experience with elastic search environment (kibana, grafana)
  • Experience of mobile network and operator-grade networking
  • Experience with KPI dashboards, data visualization and data science and analytics (Splunk, Elk, Tableau, Elastic Stack, Netscout, Database/SQL)
  • Scripting and/or Software Development Experience (Bash, Python, JavaScript)
  • Experience with Linux, server management, virtualization and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Master in Computer science or Engineering degree or related field

item.title: Manager, Marketing - Campaign Development
item.description:
Description

 

Ready to create innovative solutions to optimize 1:1 campaigns?

 

The Campaign Development team is part of the Consumer Mobility Campaign Management and Data Science Team. This team’s mandate is to deliver operational excellence through management of 1:1 campaign development while maintaining the highest level of quality standards, personalization and on-time delivery. Through partnership with multiple cross-functional groups, our team leverages our marketing technology platform investments to drive positive business outcomes.

 

What’s in it for me?

 

You will interact with many stakeholders and levels of leadership across the organization, offering a unique opportunity to learn about the diverse product categories across TELUS and blaze a path to accelerate your career. As the manager, you will be supporting a world-class team of email and SMS developers. You will be responsible for continuing to enhance our team culture of empowerment to create an environment of balance and enjoyment of day-to-day work. Focusing on workload capacity prioritization and continuous improvement in the way we work. In addition, the leader of this team will also be responsible for enhancing our marketing technology capabilities and continuously seek ways to optimize how we work.

 

What you will do:

 

  • Enable a learning, coach and support culture to assist in team member development and career growth. You thrive when helping team members achieve their full potential
  • Foster a diverse and inclusive, collaborative environment focusing on delivering high levels of team member engagement and performance
  • Recommend and implement enhancements to: marketing technology platform, process and campaign automation.
  • Develop strong collaborative relationships with a broad range of stakeholders to understand campaign development requests. Facilitating prioritization discussions, where required, to promote team work-life balance
  • Deliver quality service to our customers, team members, partners and outcome sponsors through consistent application of the TELUS value

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle:

 

  • Demonstrable experience in team member coaching and support to foster an environment of cooperation and success
  • A problem-solving mindset in terms of taking abstract questions and issues, can clearly summarize, and articulate actions to overcome
  • Resilience and adept at thinking outside the box, be curious and ask questions
  • An excellent storyteller, experience presenting to small and large audiences at different levels of the organization
  • Experience with: planning, project delivery, and business process transformation
  • Experience in agile product development with balance of technical and business outcomes
  • A proven track record in balancing immediate and long-term priorities, while being flexible and adaptable

 

Great-to-haves:

 

  • Experiences in successfully navigating large, complex companies
  • Experience with Adobe Campaign Suite with focus on marketing automation
  • Solid understanding of mobility industry dynamics

item.title: Cloud Data Architect
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Enterprise Data Layer team designs, implements and oversees the GCP analytics platform at TELUS.  Known as the DataHub, our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the organization with modern cloud native services, DataOps methodologies and processes, and a self-serve data environment to test & learn and productionalize data models enabling data driven decisions.  Our vision is to empower our TELUS business partners with a standardized platform utilizing infrastructure, policy and governance as code, setting guide rails for teams to develop their data & analytics use cases within our cloud data platform.

We are looking for technical enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solution.
Together we will build and enable best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.
 
Enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Use your analytical skills and ability to assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.


What you’ll do

 

  • Work with and listen to business and technical teams to understand their needs
  • Define the ideal cloud data architecture with a focus on self-serve, efficiency, security and privacy
  • Design and implement solutions that move us forward on our MLOPs, DevOps and infrastructure as code journey within GCP
  • Collaborate kindly and proactively with the rest of our team and our customers (internal teams at TELUS)
  • Implement best in class cloud architecture to solve business use cases from concept to production
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Provision and maintain existing platforms to facilitate growth and stability
  • Author quality documentation for any solutions implemented on both how they were implemented and how to use them

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are collaborative and able to work with various IT and business teams to deliver on outcomes 
  • You are able to share a vision and implement long-term data strategies while providing value early and often along the journey
  • You have in depth knowledge of data architecture both on premise and on GCP, AWS and / or Azure platforms and have demonstrated experience designing and implementing enterprise grade data environments
  • You have experience with cloud-native technologies, such as Terraform, Kubernetes, Composer and serverless computing
  • You have in depth experience with the flow of data between systems, cloud big data environments and tooling with applications such as BigQuery, Dataflow, BigTable, Data Catalog, CloudSQL, Vertex AI, Pub/Sub, Dataprep and Cloud Spanner
  • You can design and deploy distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You have experience with YAML and/or JSON for configuration
  • You can explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces, and APIs to senior leaders and business stakeholders
  • You understand that system stability drives availability and customer trust
  • You have demonstrated experience with Secure by Design and Zero Trust data architectures and are able to provision cloud infrastructure with best in class security
  • You have in depth knowledge of PII and privacy compliance and have demonstrated architectural design, system interactions and life cycle management that puts customer safety first
  • You are able to provide guidance to optimize data collection, storage, and consumption by choosing the right platforms and tools for the right use casesYou have good understanding of DevOps & DataOps principles and tools

 

Great-to-haves

 

 

  • Experience with Google’s BigQuery service
  • Experience with MLOPs methodologies and process
  • Data Warehousing and data modeling design experience
  • Experience with FinOps and Cloud platform budget management

item.title: Senior Design Specialist - 5G Capacity and Data Analytics
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

Join a team that is in the heart of the telecommunications revolution. Help us transform our network capacity planning processes to enter the 5G era.

 

Our team is responsible for the capacity planning of TELUS’ wireless network, this includes a broad range of data analytics and engineering activities, from projects that guide multi-year executive strategies to day-to-day network capacity planning to support the growing network traffic. You will have the opportunity not only to master new technologies, but also apply modern engineering best practices, including automation and ML/AI, to build and evolve the Best Wireless Network.

 

As a 5G Capacity and Data Analytics Specialist, you’ll provide technical leadership to ensure we efficiently plan and deploy network capacity based on customer specific requirements. The role is an intersection between Network Performance, Business Requirements and Customer Experience.

 

Your creativity coupled with strong data analytics skills and RF Engineering will allow us to find the best ways of building our wireless 4G/5G networks to support existing and new services. Finally, together as a team, we will help shape the future vision of TELUS’ wireless network by providing important guidance to executives on how best to address our evolving business challenges.

What you’ll do

 

  • By using modern data analytics and automation techniques, transform our capacity planning processes to enter the 5G service based era
  • By proactively defining novel capacity planning techniques/models for 5G/LTE use cases
  • By producing and managing the RAN network capacity plans for mobility and fixed wireless users
  • By collaborating with other technical and business teams to understand new technologies and services to make our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
  • By developing dashboards and data visualizations, you will provide insights into network capacity that can be shared with executives and peer groups
  • By monitoring network performance, you will identify actual capacity problems and predict future congestion issues in the network
  • By leading the implementation of wireless capacity augments, you will build working processes with performance and construction teams to drive improvements in customer experience

 

What you bring

 

  • Bachelor\'s degree in computer science, computer engineering or engineering
  • 7+ years of experience in mobile capacity planning and radio network design or optimization, and expertise in 5G and LTE technologies
  • Three to five years of experience in data analysis or software development
  • Proven ability to operate independently from general guidelines
  • Ability to refine (locally) or expand (nationally) analyzes based on a specific problem Ability to problem solve and make intuitive decisions using large data sets
  • Passion for data science, forecasting and using data visualization platforms like Splunk
  • Experience with SQL databases, understanding of NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB, Splunk)
  • Python experience and basic knowledge of common data analysis libraries

 

Great to haves

 

  • Master\'s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Experience with agile methodology and cloud services, preferably Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in deploying Node.js application, microservices or distributed systems

item.title: Business Consultant (Business Intelligence & Data Insights)
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

Join our fast paced team, and help us leverage your strong technical knowledge and business acumen to enable strategic data insights. The business intelligence outcomes we drive help our stakeholders and TBS leadership teams to make informed business decisions, gain deeper insights into key strategic programs, and help us understand the outcomes and consequences of competing priorities.

 

Within TELUS, our team is known as a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and a great place to learn and develop. We have a culture of collaboration, recognition, and high-performance. Simply put, if you\'re bright, ambitious and eager for a challenge, this is the place to be!

 

You ideal profile includes

 

  • Deep understanding of business intelligence and analytics, including data engineering and managing data pipelines
  • Strong conceptual and analytical skills; able to work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Strong presentation skills, avid storyteller, communicator and collaborator; able to build relationships with audiences at all levels including senior leadership
  • Strong PLSQL skills, Python, Google Cloud Platform, Big Query, Spark, Tableau, ETL Tools, etc
  • An eagerness to learn, grow, and adapt to new software tools and business needs on an ongoing basis
  • Ability to manage projects from infancy to completion

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • A high degree of emotional intelligence, interpersonal skills and thought leadership
  • Ability to produce efficient, clean and accurate content
  • Experience working with urgent and highly visible content
  • Self-organization and ability to manage multiple timelines and requirements
  • Excellent collaborative skills, with a proven track record of working with cross-functional teams such as Finance, Marketing, Product, and Operations 
  • Comfort working with all levels of the organization – from managers to senior executives
  • Ongoing desire to be part of a high paced, collaborative and exciting team focused on long term planning and business governance
  • A natural ability to form strong working relationships and transform the complicated into the simple
  • A high level of proficiency with Google Suite (especially Slides,Docs, Sheets) and storyboarding; you are able to deliver content tailored for the variety of audiences and forums you support


Great to haves

 

  • Knowledge of TELUS networks and systems
  • GCP certification
  • University degree and/or 5-6 years of equivalent combination of experience and education
  • Fundamental understanding of Data Science techniques and its strategic impact to business #LI-Remote #LI-HYBRID

item.title: Senior Data Engineer
item.description:
Our team and what we’ll accomplish together*


The Direct-To-Consumer (D2C) channel team is a fast-paced and growing residential sales team that is at the forefront of innovation for TELUS. Our D2C Data & Reporting team is responsible for arming our sales teams with the tools, processes, and data to enable a better customer experience and deliver on sales & marketing targets for TELUS. 

 

We are looking for a passionate and dynamic individual to join our team and play an important role in building critical data engineering and generating data-driven business insights for our ever-expanding D2C Channel team!  As a Sr. Data Engineer, you will lead the team across our data strategy, analysis, data integration, and data management. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with leadership teams to understand the biggest challenges to solve and are passionate about turning data into actionable insights that will accelerate channel outcomes. 

 

What you’ll do*

 

  • Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines to support the continuous increase in data volume and complexity.
  • Design and build data models, views, BI semantic layers, and BI assets for governed reporting and self-service data discovery and analytics.
  • Engineer end-to-end data solutions on both on-prem and cloud infrastructure.
  • Implement processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it.
  • Proactively investigates and troubleshoots technical and system problems with the database and maintenance of the database.
  • Be the subject-matter expert on data infrastructure, data architecture, modeling, and optimization.

What you bring*

 

  • 7+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, Business Intelligence Engineer, Database Administrator, or a similar role
  • Hands-on experience with data warehouse technologies and a strong understanding of data modeling concepts
  • Skilled at quickly deriving insights with large data sets and have at least 7+ years of hands-on experience with Oracle and SQL Server databases (SQL), and you will build the foundations as TELUS moves to the Google Cloud Platform
  • Proficiency with some of the following technologies: ORACLE, Exadata, Microsoft SQL Server, Cloud managed database, SSIS, Informatica, Talend, R, Python, GCP, Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue, Tableau, Domo, Power BI, etc.
  • You have extensive experience and in-depth knowledge of identifying requirements and building data pipeline/ data warehouse solutions & system roadmaps in collaboration with key stakeholders.
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment and at the same time able to collaborate with stakeholders
  • Excellent analytical ability, strong organizational skills, ability to prioritize, ability to multi-task, work under pressure, and meet deadlines promptly 

 

Great-to-haves*

 

  • Post-secondary degree in Computer Science or Engineering and/or equivalent experience
  • Experience working on cloud data architecture like GCP, AWS, Azure
  • 5 years of telecom and/or home security experience
  • Certification in Data Engineering/ Business Intelligence tech stack

#LI-REMOTE

item.title: Senior Project Manager, Data Engineering
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

We are the TELUS Data Strategy & Enablement team and our mission is to drive TELUS to become a world-class data insights driven organization, delivering world-class data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data and a data-product/data platform oriented culture. Our team members are passionate, dynamic, entrepreneurial and highly engaged, driven to achieve great outcomes for our customers, our team members, our communities and our environment. We believe in continuous meaningful transformation integrating dynamic change in our professional lives. Our team members are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.
 

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team’s Sr. Project Manager, Data Engineering. Reporting to the Director – Data Engineering Platforms, you will lead and deliver data driven technology projects in collaboration with the Data Engineering Platforms team. Our team is responsible for enabling, enriching and democratizating data for TELUS in order to support many business units across the organization drive revenue, realize cost savings & efficiencies and to improve the customer experience via the following major workstreams:

 

  • Master Data Management
  • Revenue Generating Unit Reporting
  • Usage and Revenue Reporting
  • Consumer and Business customer interactions
  • Data Lake and Oracle DB migration to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


We work with internal and external partners to develop new data products and services and provide the highest tier of support for our enterprise grade data pipelines to GCP for TELUS. We continuously strive to improve the reliability of our data and the overall GCP platform through technology innovations and the latest SRE best practices.
 

What you’ll do

  • Develop and implement roadmaps that provide a consolidated view including updates, delivery plans, compiling financial forecasts, tracking actuals, managing purchases, tracking material.
  • Work closely with technical teams on the end to end delivery of customer facing features and content.
  • Managing the overall portfolio budget (CAPEX & OPEX) by monitoring expenditures to ensure costs stay within the approved budgeted amount
  • Gathering and analyzing financial data to identify areas for improvement and to keep projects on budget and on time.
  • Manage infrastructure deployment and software development projects.
  • Partner with internal and external teams to deliver on strategic initiatives.
  • Balance day to day workload with the demands of a fast-paced Agile delivery team.
  • Facilitate and maintain relationships between organization and vendors/partners.
  • Contribute to the establishment of a common set of practices, tools and templates for portfolio, program, and project-level management and ensure standards are being followed.
     

Qualifications

What you bring

 

  • 3-5 years of technical project management experience delivering IT Projects on Time, on Budget and with Quality.
  • Familiarity with Scrum, SAFe agile frameworks to manage product delivery.
  • Experience working with product owners to identify skill-sets and ensure backlog completeness including estimates.
  • Understanding of Big Data, Data Architecture, Informatica ETL tools and Google Cloud Platform products and services.
  • Skilled in using JIRA, Confluence, Google Suite, Fieldglass and SAP.
  • Manage project schedules, partners & vendors identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders.
  • Ability to foster collaborative working relationships with internal and external teams through leadership, embracing diversity and introducing new ideas
  • Skillful in problem-solving and resolving issues creatively and always through a customer lens.
  • Innovative and out of the box thinking - you are curious and never stop learning.
  • Ability to manage key deliverables, project status reporting, excellent communication and presentation skills as part of an extended project team and committed to working with engineers, architects and product managers.
  • Demonstrated ability to learn, both complex technical concepts and end to end business processes.
  • Flexible in managing ambiguity, uncertainty and changing priorities.
  •  Bachelor\'s degree in Technology, Engineering, Business or other technical disciplines.

 

Great-to-haves

  •  PMP, Agile, CSM certifications.
  •  Project Management experience in software automation, cloud migrations, hardware deployments & data analytics.

item.title: Data Analyst- Collaborative Health
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.

 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

Do you thrive in a fast-paced, team centric environment? Are you a detailed-oriented person who loves solving problems by leveraging creative solutions? Do you want to be in a space where your knowledge and experience are used and fostered? Read on as this is the job for you!

 

As a key member of the TELUS Health Collaborative Health team, you will be joining a growing team of Analysts in transforming and converting health data for Canadian physicians on a TELUS EMR (Electronic Medical Record) platform. This exciting opportunity will allow you to leverage your experience and skill set within an innovative and collaborative environment while performing meaningful work that is crucial to the success of our TELUS Health EMR platforms.

 

This position will be a contract role for approximately 18-20 months.

 

What you’ll do

 

As part of the team, you’ll be responsible for:

 

  • Extracting data from various source systems and data stores by performing light business coding (ex. Java, Python, C#, etc.)
  • Connecting with our customers to conduct requirement gathering and performing data validations
  • Mapping and transforming data using various techniques (ex. XSLT, MapForce, scripting, etc.) based on customer input and requirements
  • Performing ad-hoc queries (ex. SQL, LINQ, etc.) and reports to analyze customer data before and after migration
  • Planning and performing go-live transformation and validation to ensure no data is lost or corrupted
  • Executing production data migrations (requires occasional evening/weekend work)
  • Collaboration with various teams across the business to identify roadblocks and resolve issues, to ensure timely completion for each project
  • Contributing to ongoing development and refinement of data migration tools and processes
  • Tracking issues, communicating project status, and managing project risk

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • Graduation from a post-secondary institution specializing in related technologies
  • 2+ years of experience working on data transformation or development projects
  • 2+ years of working with SQL/TSQL
  • 2+ years of working with XML and related tools (ex. XSL/XPath)
  • 2+ years of working with a scripting language (ex. Bash/JavaScript/Python/Perl/etc.)

 

Technical Knowledge:

 

  • SQL/TSQL
  • Data Transformation Scripting and Mapping (ex. XML, XSL/XPath)
  • Familiarity with databases such as MSSQL, Oracle, MySQL, etc.
  • Scripting (ex. Python/Groovy) or development (ex. Java/C#)
  • Linux/Unix and Groovy an asset

 

Functional Skills:

 

  • Detail oriented
  • Avid problem solver
  • Ability to communicate both verbally and written in English, French is an asset
  • Ability tmulti-task and manage numerous concurrent projects
  • Strong analysis and problem solving skills with the ability to identify root cause
  • Ability to communicate in an effective and respectful manner with customers and fellow team members
  • Self-directed in completing project-based work

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Agile & Project Management skills
  • Experience with Ruby On Rails would be an advantage
  • Understanding of Network Infrastructure
  • Medical experience or clinical workflow as asset
  • Experience with HL7, CoPD and CDS/CMS XML standards
  • Experience with the Atlassian tool suite (ex. Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence)
  • MapForce an asset

item.title: Junior Analytics Implementation Prime | TELUS Digital
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

We’re a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our company’s digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most.

 

TELUS Digital’s mission is to make life easier for millions of customers – and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, TELUS.com/business and the My TELUS app.

 

Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts.

 

Our team members are leaders in local and global technology communities, we value and support communities such as: Tech Masters, NodeSchool, Ladies Learning Code, Women Who Code TO and many more!

 

Learn more about our team at telus.com/digital


This is a full-time permanent position. Remote work is available anywhere in Canada.


 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

Individuals with web development experience including knowledge of JavaScript (or any of its flavors) with an interest for analytics may apply for a position within TELUS Digital. The program is designed specifically for those who are passionate about analytics, curious about new technologies and interested in using data to shape the strategy of a large organization. This is a great entry path into the digital analytics and data science team at TELUS.

 

In this role, you will be responsible to work with various stakeholders with the Digital Review Board and advise, support and work through all implementation criteria to ensure that we are able to measure what is required for the business prime to know if they are achieving their business outcomes.

 

In this role, you will gain experience setting up analytics tools for our digital properties in order to collect user interactional data from multiple sources including web, app, voice assistants and wearables. Some of the tools you will use include Adobe Marketing Cloud (Launch, Adobe Analytics, Target, Audience Manager, Campaign), DOMO, Qualtrics and Decibel.

 

Reporting into the Manager of the Digital Review Board, this position is accountable for implementation, continued integration and knowledge transfer of the Adobe product suite, specifically Adobe Analytics, across multiple TELUS Digital properties.


 

Here’s how

 

  • Ensuring that data flows smoothly from the website and app into our analytics report suite
  • Support the development of internal processes and documentation governing all aspects of analytics tagging, implementation, QA and reporting, including continuous improvement of these processes
  • Conduct regular audits of digital analytics implementation identifying recommendations to improve data structure and reporting
  • Work collaboratively with product teams to create valuable data that drives our insights and reporting. Communicate findings and recommendations in a professional, clear, and actionable manner, articulating next steps and recommendations to various audiences including executive level
  • Manage quality assurance of all analytics implementations and provide recommendations to provide insightful, best-in-class digital channels reports and dashboards, and adherence to service level agreements with lines of business, partners and the overall Digital team

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • A strong passion for analytics
  • Relevant education in fields such as computer science, engineering or information management
  • Web development experience including knowledge of JavaScript (or any of its flavors)
  • Minimum of 6 months of experience with Adobe Launch
  • Ability to work independently and as a contributing member of the team

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Experience with agile, iterative, lean product life cycles
  • Understanding of database structures, tables & basic SQL statements

 

About TELUS Digital:

 

We want to work with people who:

 

  • Share our passion for all things digital
  • Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment
  • Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers
  • Are curious, experiment and never stop learning
  • View collaboration as essential to your work
  • Utilize the power of data to inform decisions
  • Embrace diversity and new ideas

 

What you can expect from us:

 

  • Opportunity to show your stuff and be recognized and rewarded for excelling
  • A fun dynamic team that works together to find new innovative ways to drive the digital transformation of TELUS
  • An environment where you’re encouraged to share and act on your ideas, while learning new things and building your career
  • Able to work flexible hours and connect remotely with team members across Canada #LI-remote
  • A culture committed to giving back to our communities; every year we donate time and resources in our communities
  • Access to well-being resources as well as ongoing support and focus on overall team member physical and mental well-being

 

Bonus points

 

Check out http://telus.com/digital/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.

item.title: Product Designer
item.description:
Canvass AI – Disrupting how Industrials Improve Global Productivity and Sustainability

Do you want to make a positive impact on the world?

Canvass AI is disrupting the manufacturing and industrial sector by making the hype of AI a reality. Our AI platform is fast becoming the most in-demand solution on the market because we put the power of AI in the hands of industrial engineers, who can now unleash the value in their data in ways they’ve never been able to before! We are helping the world’s largest companies drive impactful results, almost instantly, from improving their productivity to spearheading their global sustainability efforts. Our software and customer deployments prove each day that AI is revolutionizing how manufacturers reduce carbon emissions, waste, water, and energy consumption.

Proudly funded by Alphabet’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Motor Ventures. Join us on the quest to build a more sustainable and productive future!

DO WHAT YOU LOVE!

Reporting to the Director of Product Management, the Product Designer’s role is to understand our users and use that understanding to define the user experience and user interface for our platform. The Product Designer will be the voice of the user and will be entrusted with making sure users can quickly adopt the Canvass platform and become long-term, loyal customers.

MAKE AN IMPACT!

  1. Design the user experience for new product capabilities and features based on understanding and having empathy for our users and the problems they are looking to solve.
  2. Work with the Engineering team to see new capabilities and features implemented in a timely fashion and ensure they are adopted by users.
  3. Maintain and contribute to the Canvass design system and ensure it is consistently applied.

‍HAVE WHAT IT TAKES?

  • University degree in a related discipline
  • 3 years’ work experience in software product design, preferably with a focus on designing data visualization products
  • A solid background in both interaction design and visual design.
  • Imbibe and iterate the design thinking process - including user-research, rapid prototyping, conducting user-test and guerilla feedback, iterative wireframing, and presenting synthesis to stakeholders.
  • Possess strong skills in SaaS UI design, solving complex Information architecture and user-flows, UX writing, and content development.
  • Experience working with and contributing to the ongoing development of a design system.

  • Excellent communication skills, able to work equally well with our customers, developers, and internal stakeholders such as Marketing and Customer Success
  • Experience working with other designers and product managers. Bringing new ideas and processes to the table to improve collaboration within the team while ensuring quality & efficient feature delivery.
  • [Nice to have] Agile software environment
  • [Nice to have] Strong data literacy and a track record of using data and experimentation to drive product decisions
  • [Bonus] Preferably you’ve worked in a startup before and understand life in a startup

As part of your application please include a portfolio that demonstrates your experience in understanding user problems and designing elegant solutions to address them.

item.title: Sales Account Executive
item.description:
Canvass AI - Industrial AI Built for Industrial Engineers

At Canvass, we are disrupting the way industrial operational data is being used to make critical business decisions. Our disruptive, leading edge AI-powered platform, transforms plant operations, giving  predictive insights that enable autonomous operations.

Canvass AI software platform is empowering industrial companies to transform industrial engineers into digital engineers who are driving data driven decisions in day to day operations. Canvass customers include leading energy, manufacturing, and mining companies around the globe.

We’re an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.

What You’ll Do

Canvass AI is seeking an Account Executive, a true hunter who wants to join our team and expand the business globally. This is an individual contributor position, newly added for business expansion.  

  • You will be identifying, negotiating and closing big deals in industrial market.  You will be comfortable presenting Canvass’s value proposition and business case to the C-Executive Suite as well as the technical users.  
  • You will be called upon to utilize superior salesmanship to develop sales opportunities and identify the necessary decision makers and champions of the prospective deal.  
  • You will listen, identify and understand customer  needs and deliver to their expectations. You will be able to build relationships with multiple stakeholders and influence them in a positive way.  
  • You will actively seek out new sales leads and business opportunities through active networking and utilizing business referrals.
  • You are hugely curious will constantly look for ways to enhance your knowledge of our industry, market, and competitors to provide that sales edge needed to close business and generate revenue.   Keep learning AND be curious: we are constantly looking for ways to enhance knowledge of our industry, market and competitors to provide the sales edge to close business and generate revenue.  
  • You will seek feedback at every opportunity so you can be the best you can be.  You will seek this from leaders, peers and clients. We do the right thing always and take extreme pride in who we are, what we build and what we do.  AND, we are led by character.
Who You Are & What Makes You Qualified

  • You are one to the top 10% of the sales people in your current company/division.  You are able to teach, tailor and take control of the sales cycle in a professional way. You are someone who pursues your passions with energy and commitment. We never, ever give up.
  • Fast learner; You are incredibly fast learner (we are in a market ready to change very fast and you have to be nimble of mind to keep up).  You have the intelligence to evolve to customer pain and map to customer personas and use cases. You will quickly learn our product, competition, processes, methodologies and how to build business cases mapped to successful business outcomes.  
  • Persistence, Heart and Desire. You will actively seek out new sales leads and business opportunities through active networking, partners and utilizing business referrals. You will be called upon to utilize superior salesmanship to develop sales opportunities and identify the necessary decision makers and influencers of the prospective deal.  get a thrill from pursuing the close which also means you are calm under pressure and can make sound decisions quickly. The confidence in our product and our company just makes it easier for you.
  • Coachability and Adaptability: You believe in following a process because it works and changing it up when it doesn’t. You want to contribute to building tactics and refining our processes for repeatable success. Being familiar with MEDDICC and Challenger Sales is a plus.
  • ‍Integrity: You will seek feedback at every opportunity so you can be the best you can be.  You will seek this from leaders, peers and clients. We do the right thing always and take extreme pride in who we are, what we build and what we do.  
  • ‍‍Curiosity: You are hugely curious will constantly look for ways to enhance your knowledge of our industry, market, and competitors to provide that sales edge needed to close business and generate revenue.  You will keep asking the customer questions and gain validation of what you heard throughout the customer journey. Keep learning. AND be curious: we are constantly looking for ways to enhance knowledge of our industry, market and competitors to provide the sales edge to close business and generate revenue.
  • You love the Digital Transformation Revolution You understand challenging the status quo will provide positive business impact to all functions of an organization is critical.
  • 5+ years success in industrial or enterprise software sales or business technology products and services.
  • Experience with and understanding of AI and Machine Learning is highly favorable.
  • Exemplary written and oral communication skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal, planning, and organizational skills.
  • "Data" experience – big data, analytics, data science, machine learning, data integration
  • Experience with selling within Industrial Manufacturing is a plus.
  • Background in selling innovation and new concepts to large Enterprises
  • Ability to travel 10 to 40%
  • Software scale up experience is a plus
  • Bachelor’s degree required

What’s in it for you

You want to join a company that’s at the forefront of leading edge technology and you want to be the person that takes us there and captures massive market share. You want to be part of an ambitious, successful team that is rapidly scaling up, that gives you room to grow and recognition as you close new accounts. With a shorter-than-usual sales cycle for enterprise, you will reap the rewards of your efforts with uncapped commission and great incentive targets.

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Inclusive culture, open to ideas
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Equity Plan

‍Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for the Industrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Ventures.

What\'s it like working at Canvass

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture.

‍

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its cutting-edge AI platform, by transforming industrial engineers into data and digital engineers. Backed by some of the world’s largest companies like Google’s Gradient Ventures, Canvass is democratizing the use of AI in day to day operations so industrial companies can build AI/ML models at scale and deploy them in production to gain business benefits in real time.

Things you should know about our tech:
  • ‍We use a microservices architecture built predominantly with Python
  • Our single-page web application is built with React and we use Django for our RESTful API layer
  • We use Kubernetes to manage our cloud deployments in Azure
  • We’ve built a data pipeline with Kafka and use Kubeflow to orchestrate our machine learning pipeline
  • We use CircleCI to continuously integrate and deploy code changes

‍What we’re looking for:

We’re looking for candidates with:

  • Experience building web applications with Python, bonus points for experience with a RESTful API framework
  • Experience using React (or other JavaScript frameworks) to build complex web applications
  • An understanding of microservice architecture and distributed system design
  • Proven track record of delivering well-designed and tested software
  • Solid understanding of relational and non-relational databases and best practices

In general, we’re looking for a senior developer that exemplify these qualities:

Activation & Engagement Our developers are critical to the progress of our application and our business. We expect our developers to maintain focus on the business impact of their changes and advocate for work that will drive outcomes instead of just output.

‍Teamwork & Collaboration Our teams are small and extremely collaborative. Developers work very closely with a small number of other developers, a designer, and a product manager to meaningfully impact the business every week.

‍Excellence & Craft Software development is more than checking features off a list of requirements. We need our developers to build systems that are accessible to new teammates and extensible so that they can evolve with our business. We want our developers to take pride in what they build.

‍Communication & Leadership A developer can have a large impact by helping to grow the abilities and understanding of their teammates. We’re looking for people who can deliver learning sessions to introduce their technical teammates to new concepts and who can explain and contextualize their work to teammates outside of engineering.

What’s in it for you

You want to join a company that’s at the forefront of leading edge technology and you want to be the person that takes us there and captures massive market share. You want to be part of an ambitious, successful team that is rapidly scaling up, that gives you room to grow and build your career as the company grows.  

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • An incredible team with Inclusive culture, open to ideas
  • You build the future of the planet. An opportunity to work in a leading edge AI company that is making the planet safer and greener for the future.  
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with option to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Equity Plan
What\'s it like working at Canvass

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions. We have an inclusive culture and we are driven by the passion to make an impact to the future of the industrial sector which in turn impacts the climate sustainability.
