Education:      Degree in a related field

Division:          OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Simulation Developer to work in the Fleet Software Group.

The Fleet Software Group is responsible for the design, development and support of the Fleet Manager and software applications that allow our users to interact with, monitor and support their fleets of OTTO Autonomous Vehicles. This involves participation in the entire product workflow, from customer insight gathering, problem definition, solution proposals, application design, development and support.

For this role we are seeking an individual to develop & maintain software tools and assets used in our simulation stack. You will be working closely with other members of the DevOps, Vehicle Systems, Fleet software development teams as well as many other groups within OTTO Motors, in order to provide robust and easy-to-use solutions to the problems our employees & customers need to solve with their simulation environments and workflows.

About You

For the role of Simulation Developer we are seeking an experienced developer to support, maintain, and extend robotic simulations in a full-stack simulation environment in a small team.  Your work will directly support a variety of internal groups in testing, developing and training.

Responsibilities:

  • Designing and developing new simulation tools and assets.
  • Maintaining and extending existing simulation automation/deployment tools and assets.
  • Improving useability and robustness of our simulation tool set.
  • Writing internal documentation for new and existing simulation tools and assets.
  • Troubleshooting simulation automation/deployment issues and bugs.
  • Supporting development operations, internal tools, and infrastructure.
  • Supporting development systems infrastructure.

 Additional responsibilities may include:

  • Developing, maintaining, and extending simulation plugins, both internal and upstream.
  • Alerting the team and stopping the robots from starting their own revolution.

Skills and experience:

  • Minimum 2-5 years of experience in software development in an enterprise environment.
  • Object-oriented programming experience (C++).
  • Working with Linux/Ubuntu based environments and scripting (Bash, Python 3.5+).
  • Use of emplating formats and markup languages (e.g. XML, YAML, JSON).
  • Using continuous integration (Jenkins/GitLab pipelines) and source control (Git).
  • Diagnosing and narrowing down the source of issues.
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagram, discussion, and example.
  • Creating/maintaining virtual models & environments in a physics based simulator.

Bonus Points For:

  • Other object-oriented programming experience (e.g. C#, Java)
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems.
  • Experience with Gazebo/Unity/Unreal/Isaac simulation.
  • Experience in 3D graphics software and programming.
  • Experience with containers and Kubernetes
  • Familiarity with Nix

item.description:
Description

Position:          Quality Analyst

Location:          Kitchener, Ontario         

Experience:      2+ yrs relevant work experience

Education:        Diploma/Degree in a related field 

Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require an organized individual to assist with inspection of a variety of made to spec. components, to assist with analysis on issued MTS/OTS parts and to communicate solutions to all vested parties. We need a Quality Analyst to take responsibility in ensuring our core products are built with components of the utmost quality as well as ensuring our core products are capable of handling specified end-user requirements. You will be a part of our Quality team helping us make sure that Clearpath robots can handle the world’s dullest, dirtiest and deadliest jobs for many years.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Incoming quality inspection of made to spec harnesses and printed circuit board assemblies
  • Testing, troubleshooting of Electrical Harnesses, PCBAs, Electrical Bays/Panels, etc.
  • In process and finished goods quality validation
  • Assist in the creation of NCR’s and document issues learned from your diagnosis
  • Process/Traceability documentation

Additional tasks may include:

  • Assisting mechanical inspections, assembly inspections, as needed
  • Process implementation and refinement
  • Participating in Continuous Improvement and 5S activities
  • All other duties as assigned

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required Technical Skills:

  • Ability to read a schematic, identify mechanical/electrical components and determine root cause of PCB or robot test failures
  • Practical understanding of mechanical/electrical defects
  • Practical understanding of cable assembly, PCBA quality standards and common defects
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and Word, Google Sheets and Docs.

Bonus points for:

  • Any of IPC-7711, IPC-7721, IPC-A-600, IPC-9121, IPC-610, IPC-620 training or equivalent
  • Familiarity with Linux
  • Familiarity with ISO standards

item.title: Robot Builder
item.description:
Description

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About the Job:

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of assembling a variety of different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Builder to take responsibility in assembling our core products along with their accessories.

You will contribute to a team dedicated to seeing a robotic platform from start to finish. Additionally, when you are not wrenchin’ down screws, you will be tasked with maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the production area.

This position requires the worker to be on site for the full daily shift. There is no opportunity to work from home. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Electromechanical Assembly of robotic platforms 
    • Use of hand tools
    • Use of hoisting equipment
    • Cable installation and wire routing
  • Rotating throughout different assembly stations to achieve cross-training among team members
  • Ensuring your workspace follows 5S guidelines
  • Using a computer for work instructions via VKS system
  • Production area maintenance
  • Production equipment maintenance
  • Other duties as assigned

About You:

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  

Required Skills:

  • Experience working on manual product assembly
  • Wiring or cable installation experience preferred
  • Hands-on experience with common tools, eg, screwdriver, hammer, and electric drills.
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and GSuite
  • Able to work the Day shift Hours 7am - 3pm Monday to Friday
  • Positive and professional attitude with safety mindset
  • Proven ability to work independently
  • Experience working with ERP systems is an asset.
  • Ability to follow written assembly work instructions in English
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs comfortably 

Bonus points for:

  • Hobbies that involve working with power tools, woodworking for instance
  • Hobbies that involve assembly with hand tools, car maintenance for instance
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • Continuous Improvement Process
  • 5S methodology
  • Previously being part of a Health & Safety Committee

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Corporate discounts and Group Insurance (home and auto)
  • Free snacks to keep you energized during the shift!
  • Cool company events such as BBQs and other celebrations including occasional food trucks at the facilities
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Friendly and fun co-workers!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Logistics Coordinator
item.description:
Description

Title:            Logistics Coordinator
Location:     Kitchener, Ontario
Term:           Full-Time
Education:   College Diploma
Experience: 0+ years of relevant work experience
Salary:         $22/hr
Other:          G or G2 driver’s license and access to a vehicle


About OTTO Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

As OTTO Motors grows exponentially, so does the need to receive, handle materials, package, and ship robots. You are adaptable. Where others see barriers, you see opportunities for improvement. No day is the same - curveballs won’t make you break a sweat! This position offers the best mix of responsibility, challenge, and enjoyment. We need someone to come in, take charge, and help keep our materials and shipments moving smoothly.

Reporting into our Logistics Lead, as our Logistics Coordinator you will wear many hats, work with every department in our company, and be around robots that are paving the way for the material handling revolution. 

This position requires the employee to be on site for the full day shift. There is no opportunity to work from home. The performance of duties in this position will require the candidate to travel locally (within Kitchener-Waterloo) to our various locations. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Sign for and unload packages from couriers, inspect for visual damage.
  • Sign for and unload trucks using a forklift or reach truck
  • Receiving Purchase orders in a timely and efficient manner.
  • Put parts away in their proper locations
  • Timely execution of Pick and ship spare parts orders
  • Print Pick lists and kit items to support production
  • Ensure the Shortage Report is accurate and up to date.
  • Quote and arrange small package/LTL shipments to international and domestic customers.
  • Packing shipments large and small
  • Assist with the coordination of logistics for off-site demonstrations, events and trade shows worldwide.
  • Maintain our ERP system to ensure it reflects accuracy during transactions (Receiving, Inventory Transfer, Kitting and shipping).
  • Working closely with Production, Purchasing, and Client Success teams, to improve inter-departmental cooperation and effectiveness.
  • Other duties as assigned.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required Skills:

  • Detail-oriented and exceptionally organized.
  • Experience with Microsoft Excel, Word.
  • Comfortable navigating a computer and using software tools
  • Able to quickly evaluate and assess a problem situation and prioritize courses of action.
  • Able to work under pressure and tight deadlines.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
  • Must be a team player and self-motivated.
  • Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds

Bonus points for: 

  • Being an H.T.S code whiz!
  • Previous forklift and/or reach truck experience.
  • Comfortable using pallet jacks.
  • Experience with shipping freight domestically/internationally using UPS and FedEx.
  • Experience working with EPR systems and/or JIRA.
  • Familiar with inventory/cycle counting, finding root causes and solving discrepancies.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Product Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:             Product Manager

Location:            Kitchener, Ontario

Experience:        3 Years of relevant work experience

Education:         Bachelors Degree

Division:             OTTO Motors

Type:                  Full-Time Permanent

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com. 

About the Opportunity:

We are looking for a product manager to add to our growing team. We need someone with a track record of success bringing great products to market. An ideal candidate has experience bringing enterprise-grade software to market, comes from an automation background or really understands the industrial automation, manufacturing, or distribution space.

 

You will be responsible for a critical part of our portfolio in material movement and your experience in product management will help you drive the products’ success. You will work closely with the rest of the OTTO product development team to make sure that we are delivering properly engineered solutions. You will work closely with both sales and marketing to ensure your products are competitive, valuable and understood in the marketplace.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to product strategy, vision, and execution of our software to ensure the health, well-being and happiness of our robots.
  • Build a detailed near- and long-term product roadmap. Validate with key customers and stakeholders.
  • Translate software requirements into product deliverables and drive them to completion
  • Work closely with the engineering team to deliver great software solutions
  • Act as a product evangelist internally and externally champion the best in class material movement platform
  • Be the expert on the competition and how to beat them.

Required Experience/Skills:

Product Managers come from various backgrounds, therefore, most importantly we are looking for someone who matches the description above and is looking to take on the world. That being said we consider these baselines for our next team member:

  • You have been building software products for a while and have 3 years’ experience shipping products as a product manager
  • You have a degree or diploma in Business or Engineering related fields
  • You have worked with engineering teams as a product owner and have demonstrable experience leading cross-functional teams to define, execute and iterate on projects
  • You are adept at both verbal and visual communication and can lead teams through difficult decisions.
  • You have a demonstrable track record shipping high-quality product, and can excel in product design when required
  • You can break down strategy into tactics and tactics into metrics

What’s in it for you:

  • Meaningfully contribute to a compelling vision
  • Work-life balance (flexible hours)
  • Competitive compensation
  • Health benefits
  • Career development
  • Equity 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Technical Support Specialist (Rotating Shifts)
item.description:
Description

Position:      Technical Support Specialist
Location:     Kitchener
Job  Type:   Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 3+ years customer-facing work experience
Education:   Bachelors in related field
Division:      OTTO Motors 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath is seeking a Technical Support Specialist to join our highly skilled team in Kitchener. At
Clearpath we believe that every client is a VIP and we need someone who will obsessively focus on
making our customers successful.
You will be responsible for providing remote post-sales customer service and technical support to
our rapidly growing list of customers globally.  Don’t worry if you encounter a complex technical
challenge, we have a team of insanely smart robotics engineers (the brain surgeons of robotics!)
who will help you troubleshoot.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

 Advanced Level technical support to our customers
 On-call Escalation Support
 Organizing warranty parts and repairs
 Triage and customer assistance
 Escalating tickets and coordinating engineering teams with support efforts
 On-boarding new customers
 Acting as a customer advocate internally
 Chasing down a solution internally to a deployed customers issue
 Supporting our partners deploying systems at new customer sites

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view
work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be
surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are
motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding
problems.   Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Client-facing Skills:
 5+ years customer-facing work experience
 Strong communicator (written and verbal), with excellent phone and email manners
 Naturally friendly, energetic and empathetic personality
 Well organized and responsive, with great problem solving and negotiation skills
 Passionate about making people happy through exceptional service
 Basic grasp of technology and robotics
 Solid grasp of software architecture, and IT systems
 Communicating technical ideas in an easy to understand way

Technical Skills:
 Hardware/Electrical hands-on troubleshooting
 Computer networking and applicable industrial standards
 Data analytics

Bonus points for:
 Linux (Ubuntu), C, C++, Python
 ROS knowledge
 Ability to work evenings 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and
accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry,
disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and
expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Training Content Designer/Developer (Technical)
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position:       Training Content Designer/Developer (Technical)
Location:      Kitchener, Ontario
Experience:   3+ years
Education:    CPA, BBA or MAcc
Division:       OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The integrator enablement team at OTTO Motors is accountable for creating training content, designing training delivery programs, and for administering the delivery of training for the OTTO Motors’ dealers and systems integrator (SI) network.  The SI network consists of SI partners and self-integrating end-user clients. The deliverables and services provided by this group are essential for the day-to-day operations of the business as well as to the growth of the business as it expands the SI partner network. It also helps the business stay ahead of a market trend of more clients wanting to self-integrate autonomous mobile robots (AMRs) into their operations.

This team also plays a role in improving our product by advising on product features and the product roadmap to simplify the user experience and amount of time and effort involved with designing, deploying, and integrating OTTO Motors products. 

As the Training Content Designer/Developer, you will take on the following responsibilities and roles. 

  • be a creative contributor to the development and design of our e-learning and in-class content;
  • create storyboards and detailed scripts for videos, labs, and qualification exercises;
  • assist in configuring and administering a learning management system (LMS);
  • configure simulation environments used in the labs;
  • administer the training content library(ies) and database;
  • facilitate contributions from our subject matter expert (SME) and content production networks; and,
  • participate in the production of videos and other content (e.g. be the voice and hands in the videos)
  • You will also need to understand the technology of OTTO Motors products at a depth that allows you to design training material that explains the theory and principles of our project.

Required skills:

  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Good verbal communication skills
  • Effective and productive creative thinking and translating creative ideas into tangible content concept and designs
  • Self-starter based only on the guidance of an objective statement or a statement of a desired outcome
  • Preference for an ability to sketch visual storyboards and visual concepts 

You may also get involved in or be responsible for the following items.

  • It will be important to participate in deployments, system updates, and delivery of client training periodically to keep yourself up to speed and directly aware of the product and the associated learner and user experiences.
  • Capturing client feedback about their training and e-learning experience and planning improvements to future training content.
  • Writing product requirements documents and advocating for new product features (in collaboration with product management).
  • Capturing reference implementations and reference designs
  • Facilitating knowledge transfer between product management, product development, and systems integration teams (internal, external)

Required background:

  • Familiar with designing and deploying industrial factory automation
  • Preference for experience with training/educational content design, production, and/or management of an LMS
  • Preference for familiarity with principles of effective adult education

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates the movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The integrator enablement team at OTTO Motors is accountable for creating training content, designing training delivery programs, and for administering the delivery of training for the OTTO Motors’ dealers and systems integrator (SI) network.  The SI network consists of SI partners and self-integrating end-user clients. The deliverables and services provided by this group are essential for the day-to-day operations of the business as well as to the growth of the business as it expands the SI partner network. It also helps the business stay ahead of a market trend of more clients wanting to self-integrate autonomous mobile robots (AMRs) into their operations.

This team also plays a role in improving our product by advising on product features and the product roadmap to simplify the user experience and amount of time and effort involved with designing, deploying, and integrating OTTO Motors products. 

As the Training Program Manager, you will take on the following responsibilities and roles. 

  • Owner and product manager of the OTTO Motors standard training offerings
  • Designer of training programs (sequencing and segmentation of the content, client experience design, scheduling strategies, etc.)
  • You will be accountable for all tools involved in the delivery of training, including the LMS, simulation tools, plus physical assets and space
  • Liaison for the network of trainers (in-house and 3rd party)
  • Owner of the train-the-trainer programs (onboarding new trainers into the network)
  • Owner of the scheduling and fulfillment process
  • Advisor and approver for custom (client specific) enablement/training programs
  • Program manager for content creation work plans

You may also get involved in or be responsible for the following items.

  • It will be important to participate in deployments or system updates periodically to keep yourself up to speed and directly aware of the product and the associated learner and user experiences.
  • Writing product requirements documents and advocating for new product features (in collaboration with product management).
  • Advising on the pricing strategy for OTTO Motors training services and products.
  • Facilitating a multi-department training client experience working group.
  • Capturing client feedback about their training and learning experience and planning improvements to future training programs.

Required skills:

  • good planner (training program roadmap, training delivery, prioritization of content development, etc.)
  • good listener (i.e. onboarding client and team feedback)
  • strong facilitator, directly with clients and sales, and also for the multi-department training working group (product, pre-sales, product development, simulation tools development, etc. )
  • strong written and verbal communication
  • technical acuity (e.g. understanding of OTTO Motors products,  effective teaching, and instructional design) 

Required Background:

  • 2+ years experience as a direct contributor role in an industrial automation integration role, preferably integrating AMRs into factories + 1 year experience participating as a project manager or similar lead role on a project wherein you had multiple supporting contributors working under your guidance
  • Experienced customer-facing communicator
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada or USA at time of application

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Account Executive
item.description:
Description

Position:          Account Executive 
Location:          Remote - North America
Experience:      5 + Years’ experience selling technical products, preferably material handling solutions
Division:          OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath is automating the world and we need your help.  Got what it takes?

We’re looking for a passionate, self-driven, and motivated Account Executive (AEx) to join our OTTO Motors Sales Organization. We strive to become the ‘renaissance people’ of deal-making, with proven skills across all account functions: strategic account planning, business development, direct technical sales, and account administration. This is a remote position, with 50% travel required – you will receive support from the team regardless of location.

You will:

  • Pursue target accounts in your territory, infiltrate those accounts at the highest decision-making level, and secure that business.
  • Devise account strategies that leverage OTTO solutions and go-to-market strategy to expand OTTO within target accounts
  • Develop business relationships across the organization elevating Clearpath’s position within the executive ranks. 
  • Work with clients to identify materials handling automation opportunities in their facilities, promote and demonstrate the OTTO solution and engage the customers in projects with compelling business cases.    
  • Be responsible for pipeline growth and revenue growth in your territory.
  • Devise your personal strategy to systematically conquer your slice of the globe... and we will do everything we can to support you along the way!  
  • The AEx reports directly to the Director of Sales. You will be paid a base salary plus commissions and benefits.

Ideal Sales Characteristics:

Our next AEx is a sharp, articulate and persuasive person, who is 100% comfortable spending their days talking to highly-technical Production Engineers, Facility Directors and VP and C Level Executives.

  • Coachability – ability to understand feedback and change behavior
  • Curiosity – ability and desire to ask probing questions
  • Prior Success – based on previous sales results and/or ambition
  • Intelligence – ability to become a subject matter expert
  • Emotional Intelligence – self-awareness, self-management, social awareness and relationship building with others 
  • Passion – brings an intense enthusiasm to the team
  • Work Ethic – willingness to put in the extra effort to succeed
  • Preparation – technical aptitude of product and market/buyer understanding
  • Competitiveness – a drive to succeed that enables higher performance
  • Adaptability - ability to adapt and succeed in a fast-paced environment
  • Culture Fit – fit with company core values and culture

Required Skills and Experience: 

  • University degree in a STEM, Business or related field
  • Minimum 5+ years of relevant industry experience in a variety of technical roles including Applications Engineering, Project/Program Management and Technical Sales
  • Proven success in Business Development, Direct Sales and/or Key Account Management
  • Experience selling to mid market and enterprise organizations
  • Experience with CRM products such as Salesforce.com is an asset
  • Excellent communication skills, and the ability to deliver compelling presentations to prospects, customers, and partners.
  • Strategic thinker who is also hands-on to get results
  • Ability to travel to customers 25-50% of the time.

What’s in it for you:

  • Work-life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10am-3pm EST
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/work
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the world’s deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Product Owner
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Product Owner, Intact Lab

As a Product Owner (PO) on the Acquisition team, you are responsible for ensuring delivery of strategic value for Intact’s online quote and sales. In order to maximize the business value generated by the digital work environment, the PO will integrate and manage the needs and expectations of the various stakeholders in operational, technical and other business areas. You will be part of a small squad with the goal of creating and enhancing our Acquisition digital products to the point where our product is the best product out there, period.

Reporting to the IT Manager, your main responsibilities are:

  • End to end ownership of deliverables within the Scrum Team 
  • Build, edit and maintain the team’s backlog, priorities and roadmap
  • Collect and integrate the needs, requirements and expectations of the stakeholders, clients and collaborators into the team’s backlog
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define the product vision and strategy ensuring their interests are included in the release.
  • Inspire the Scrum Team to deliver best-in-class products
  • Responsible and accountable for leading, planning and tracking all business aspects of the project, including ensuring the right product is being built in the right order and release is developed by the identified deadlines
  • Monitors performance and recommends schedule changes or resource additions
  • Ensures business objectives and targets are met through data analytics, and feedback
  • Participate in all Scrum Ceremonies
  • Follow our competitors and the industry and keep abreast of Agile/Scrum best practices and new trends

What you bring to the table:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in a related field
  • 3 to 8 years of experience in Product Management (Business, Functional, Information)

Required qualities:

  • Be customer oriented
  • Rigor in the quality of deliverables and in the follow-up of the files entrusted
  • Ability to learn environments and systems to be up and running quickly
  • Know how to plan and organize
  • Good problem-solving skills
  • Dynamism
  • Autonomy
  • Open minded and opened to changes
  • Communication: summarize in a clear and concise manner, know how to adapt the level of language (verbal and written) and the content of the message according to the type of business or technical worker, demonstrate skills to work with people from different backgrounds, locally or remotely, in both French and English

Specific experiences - Assets strongly considered:

  • Project experience in Agile/Scrum
  • Experience and knowledge in the insurance field
  • Mastery of JIRA & Confluence
  • Knowledge of InVision, Abstract or Miro
  • Knowledge of Adobe Omniture

    Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

    • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
    • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career

    What we offer

    Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

    • A financial rewards program that recognizes your success

    • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

    • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

    • Flexible work arrangements

    • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

    • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

    • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

    • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

    • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

    • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

    • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

    We are an equal opportunity employer

    At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

    If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

    Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.
     

    If you are an employee of Intact, belairdirect, or Johnson Insurance, please apply for this role on Contact People.

item.title: Senior Scrum Master, Coordinator, DataLab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Do you want to produce innovative solutions using Artificial Intelligence (AI) that bring tangible and undeniable value to your organization?  Do you like building solutions in an agile environment?  Do you want to have a major impact on the AI and Machine Learning (ML) vision of the largest insurer in Canada?  We have the perfect opportunity for you!

Do you consider product development a team sport? Are you the keeper of team happiness, performance and purpose? Are you a motivator, an instigator, a mischief-maker? But are you a really good listener, ready to mold a process that serves the people and the product?  Good! We were looking for you!

Your mission:

As a Scrum Master, you play a crucial role in facilitating, shaping and reshaping the Agile process to keep the teams engaged and performant. 

  • Act as Scrum Master for multiple teams.
  • Guiding the team and organization on how to use the best Agile practices and shape the process to serve the team.
  • Form and chaperon teams to the next level of performance and maturity.
  • Removing impediments or guiding the team to remove impediments by connecting them with the right people in the right places.
  • Building a trusting and safe environment where problems can be raised without fear of blame, retribution, or being judged, with an emphasis on healing and problem-solving.
  • Assisting with internal and external communication, improving transparency, and radiating information.
  • Supporting and educating the Product Owner, especially on grooming and maintaining the product backlog.
  • Lead by example. 
  • Collaborate with other Scrum Masters.
  • Be part of the communities of practice for Scrum Masters.
  • Work closely and manage follow ups with various collaborators: Developers, Data Scientists, Data governance, Security, Product Owners and Architecture

You are: 

  • Engaging, self-motivated.
  • Passionate for building a great team culture.
  • You excel at leveraging conflict situations for reflection and learning.
  • Organized and proactive, always planning a surprise for the team.
  • A good listener, always listening to the beat.
  • Comfortable working in complex environments that are constantly evolving and multidisciplinary teams.
  • Good organization and priority management skills.
  • Bilingual in French and English

You have:

  • Recognized Scrum Master Certification.
  • At least 5 years of experience as a dedicated Scrum Master and 8 years experience in agile product development.
  • Good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency.
  • Experience with a variety of Agile approaches and concepts in a large-scale context.
  • At ease with Atlassian suite tools, such as Jira, Confluence.
  • Knowledge of IT Infrastructure, Software Engineering, and Machine learning concepts are an asset.

#LI-IT #LI-Hybrid

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • A financial rewards program that recognizes your success

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

item.title: Manager, Software Development
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Manager, Quality Assurance and Performance, Intact Lab

 

Intact Lab is looking for a Manager, Quality Assurance and Performance, reporting to the Senior Director, Software Engineering. Are you passionate about quality assurance? Are you an advocate for extraordinary technologies and user experiences? Want to be at the forefront of the #fintech revolution? Then join the ranks of Intact Lab, a digital innovation hub with the spirit of a start-up within the largest insurance company in Canada!

 

We are transforming our industry to make it simpler, easier and more transparent for millions of Canadians. Our customers are important to us, and we work to provide them with great tools and services that save them time, make their lives easier, and protect what matters most to them.

Your future responsibilities:

  • Manage, coach and support the QA team with your leadership skills. Be sure to take them to the next level in their art.

  • Define the automated testing strategy representing the customer experience and the interactions with the various IFC systems

  • Define and implement a test structure supporting the development cycle of our digital products

  • Ensure sound management of test environments and data

  • By being a fervent follower of test automation and mocked data, see to these practices manage in an exemplary way

  • Implement a test model by component, "scalable" and reusable.

  • Ensure that the test strategy implemented is well defined and can support our mobile and web applications

  • Define and implement a process for the sound management of test environments

Your profile :

  • Extensive experience in quality assurance and test automation.

  • Extensive knowledge of automated testing methods and frameworks.

  • Concrete experience in transforming test practices in agile mode (Scrum, safe, etc.).

  • Good experience as a manager and team coach.

  • Degree in Information Technology, Software Engineering or other related discipline.

  • Excellent level of communication in both French and English (Need to Interact on a regular basis with colleagues across the country).

 

What we offer:

  • Inspirational colleagues.

  • Stimulating challenges.

  • A competitive salary.

  • An annual bonus.

  • A flexible work schedule of 35 hours per week in Hybrid mode.

  • Modern offices in downtown Montreal (metro McGill).

  • Unparalleled medical and dental insurance, including walk-in virtual health care.

  • A pension fund and stock purchase plan.

  • And several other advantages and benefits (gym reimbursement, conferences, training, etc.).

 

 

We look forward to meeting you!

item.title: Senior Business Analyst
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

We’re looking for a Senior IT Business Analyst to join our growing team!
 

Your Mission

As an AI Engineering BA you’ll play a lead role in various initiatives to lead the team, represent AI in various forums and coordinate with other stakeholders, define requirements while building and keeping a full view of project/feature delivery.

  • Work closely with Data Scientists to understand, define and document functional and non functional requirements for AI Engineering.
  • Lead / participate in solution workshops to specify IT solutions, after consulting with all stakeholders.
  • Provide vision, leadership and guidance to DS and AI Engineering team when required.
  • Work closely with architects to come up with the right solution.
  • Analyze, profile data.
  • Work closely with Product Owner and Scrum Master to prioritize, write user stories, groom product and sprint back log with the team.
  • Support the development of solutions and the perform analysis.
  • Participate in test activities with DS, other IT teams and testers to make sure solution are built with good quality.
  • Conduct impact assessments and effort estimates for approving and documenting the IT solution using effective methods and interacting with both business users and the IT project teams. Provide statuses to management.
  • Ensure proactive and effective communication at all levels.
  • Anticipate problems and sensible situations, propose solutions and participate in the resolution.
  • Write use cases, business rules, etc.

Your Skills

You have

  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, mathematics or equivalent experience.
  • 5 to 8 years of experience as a Functional Analyst.
  • 3 + years of experience in Agile/Scrum development.
  • Knowledge of development methodologies (Agile BI, SDLC, SCRUM, Kanban).
  • Knowledge of writing user stories, understanding business priorities and sizing of user stories.
  • Expertise in data behaviour analysis and profiling.
  • Experience and knowledge of SQL.
  • Knowledge of Machine Learning concepts
  • Experience and application knowledge in the insurance field.
  • Very good communication skills, spoken and written, with AI management as well as with our business, IT and DS partners and our management team.

Nice to Have

  • Bilingual is a plus
  • Exposure to MongoDB.
  • Exposure to Java, Python, Spark
  • Understanding of Cloud technologies: AWS, Snowflake , DataBricks

You are

  • Interested in Artificial Intelligence, able to interact with software engineers, data scientists and R&D teams.
  • Fast learner. We’re looking for team members who thrive on applying their knowledge, learning new technologies. You should be able to adapt easily to meet the rapid pace of a rapidly evolving research, development, and testing environment.
  • Fearlessness. You think a working proof-of-concept is the best way to make a point. You strive on proving that speed and quality are not conflicting. Comfortable working in complex environments.
  • Versatility. In addition to having a good knowledge of the software engineering fields, you understand how all the pieces fit together into integrated systems, and how they meet business requirements. Very good communicator.
  • Passion. You feel ownership over everything you ship. You pride yourself on efficient monitoring, strong documentation, and proper test coverage. A mobilizer and delivery oriented.
  • A team player. You believe that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You rely on others\' candid feedback for continuous improvement.

Internal Candidates

  • For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • A financial rewards program that recognizes your success

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

item.description:

Our Intact Lab in Hong Kong is looking for an experienced Lead QA Engineer to join the AI Engineering team.

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our latest lab is located in the Hong Kong Science and Technology Park to turn this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI.

As a tech pioneer in a new AI lab, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Contribute to high performing and scalable data analytics pipeline for real-life customer and business issues

  • Influence the AI roadmap for the largest home, auto business insurer in Canada

  • Explore and master new technologies to use them in your own solutions

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our lab turns this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. item.title: Project Manager - Large Programs at Data Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

We’re looking for an IT Project Manager (Large Programs) to join our growing team!

In this role, the Program Manager will work collaboratively with multiple teams, overseeing all activities and aspects of the data retention and archiving program. The teams and stakeholders are diverse (Legal, Data Governance, IT, and business units). This is a high visibility program that requires strong communication and planning skills as well as a great deal of rigour.


What you will accomplish with us:

  • Maintain a constant business focus and understanding of the current strategic direction of Intact technologies.
  • Master the business case while developing an understanding of the field of business.
  • Manage projects with an understanding of company strategies, priorities, and issues.
  • Assess capabilities to be able to propose appropriate solutions and deliver company values.
  • Manage stakeholders and maintain good relationships with internal and external collaborators.
  • Define the mandate of an infrastructure program/project, as well as its scope in collaboration with the program/project sponsors.
  • Initiate activities to start projects and establish a vision of the scope with the sponsor.
  • Break the project down into manageable tasks and establish a functional organizational chart with roles and responsibilities.
  • Develop and maintain integrated project plans by identifying deliverables and dependencies, estimating duration and associated costs, and assisting in the assignment of human resources to sub-activities.
  • Provide timely advice to experts and sponsors throughout the project to achieve and meet objectives.
  • Ensure that the investment in the project provides the best deliverables/products or maximum value to the client/sponsor.
  • Build, direct and coordinate, in direct and/or indirect supervision mode, the activities of a multidisciplinary team including PMs and PCOs.
  • Report on the overall project (progress, issues, costs, closure, etc.) while respecting established performance indicators.
  • Lead the management of project risks.
  • Effectively manage project delivery.
  • Maintain dashboards periodically and progressively throughout the program/project.
  • Anticipate issues and difficult situations and take the necessary steps to resolve them.
  • Ensure proactive and effective communication at all levels of the project.
  • Ensure that proper communication channels are in place between project collaborators.
  • Manage relationships with the client, senior management, and key project leads (if applicable) and meet their expectations.
  • Provide leadership and vision to the project.
  • Formalize processes and quality control.
  • Assist in the development and support of Intact’s project management practices.


What you bring to the table:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or any equivalent combination of training and experience
  • PMP certification (an asset)
  • Minimum 8 to 10 years relevant experience
  • Minimum 3 years of experience managing infrastructure projects
  • Experience in Agile project delivery
  • Experience negotiating contracts with the procurement sector
  • Experience managing projects as part of a program
  • Experience working with project management tools (Clarity, MS Project, other)
  • Experience working in a virtual environment
  • Experience in matrix resource management
  • Data governance knowledge and experience (an asset)

item.title: Senior Data Engineering Developer
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

We are looking for two people with strong data engineering and technical leadership backgrounds for our teams.

Our data science lab is one of the largest in the country, and data engineering is one of its main pillars. We have big ambitions and want you to be part of them. Will you join us? Here’s a sneak peak.

On a day-to-day basis, we primarily use cloud technologies. AWS, DataBricks, Snowflakes and Informatica-IICS among others. Python is our favourite language! We are responsible for ingesting data from many difference sources, but also for the sometimes complex transformation of this data, to provide our scientists with quality data that is ready for machine learning.

In this mission, you will be supported by quality analysts, business analysts, application architects, and data architects. We use Scrum as our organizational methodology, with the support of our product owners and our scrum masters.

What you will accomplish with us:

  • With your team, you will participate in the design, development and delivery of efficient, effective and secure data flows.

  • Building on your experience, you will have the opportunity to participate in the implementation of industry best practices.

  • Through your leadership, you will be an agent of change who will grow our data engineering practice to make our lab an industry benchmark.

What you bring to the table:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics or any equivalent combination of training and experience.

  • 5+ years experience in software engineering / data engineering / ETL development / Data Warehousing.

  • Experience in Big Data and Cloud technologies for processing large volumes of data.

  • Understanding of data management, security and classification.

  • Understanding of machine learning and artificial intelligence.

  • Proficiency in the Python programming language and the PySpark Framework. Java is a major asset.

You are unsure you meet all the criteria to apply for this job? Why not give it a shot? You don’t have to know everything! At Intact, we support our employees in their career progression and in learning new skills, and the same goes for you!
